Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Aqswdefrgthy
Reviews.Content: The Acapulco is a first class hotel. They are very accommodating and provide you with everything to make sure your vacations goes well. They had an excellent breakfast special which was convenient for travelers looking to hit the road early to do there sit seeing. Along with a great breakfast the locations is ideal for anyone trying to see Daytona beach and just 2 miles from downtown Daytona!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy!!!”
Reviews.Author: castcs
Reviews.Content: Dont write reviews much, but this place earned it. Never been to Daytona Beach,drove down for a couple of days with no reservation. Stopped at a few different hotels, Acapulco had the best rates,very friendly staff. So we asked to see the rooms, very helpfully in showing us there rooms. Stayed oceanfront and was very happy we choose this place. If your looking for a 5 star,like some people that gives review, no need to stay here, but if your looking for a relaxing and enjoyable stay I would give them a 4 out of 5. My family sure will go back. Keep up the good work Acapulco and Thank You

Reviews.Title: “** Bad News **”
Reviews.Author: bullybabes
Reviews.Content: we went in April 2012 , was not what I expected pool was marked off by yellow tape for a few days , one hot tub out of two was boarded up and the other was well lets just say i wouldnt go in it ! there is really no food restaurant except the continental breakfast and that is ok................the bar was open once for a few hours ........ the room was ok , except they were varnishing our floor and had fans going that was really sickening , i actually was sick to my stomack from the horrible fumes our smoke alarm went off at like 330 am in our room maintenance came and dismantled it , we had no alarm for a few days i reminded the front desk a couple times ........... rugs in hallways were very dirty all the time , elevators have problems as well could be a very nice place but the management who was new was not upto par at all ............oh well i know not to go there again , had wierd things charges to my credit card 4 months later from this hotel , very strange and not trustworthy at all..........in all my travels i have never seen my credit card be billed for a stay that i left with a zero balance , never had charged anything to my room at all , i had been shocked to see my card used , my trip was bought last summer in full on hotwire , and somehow the hotel billed my card four months after i checked out with a 0 balance , beware go elsewhere ..........

Reviews.Title: “Daytona Beach choice motel”
Reviews.Author: DCA874
Reviews.Content: We decided on the spur-of-the-moment to take our out-of-town daughter to the beach this week. I made several calls to other motels. But I chose the Acapulco because the gal who took the reservations offered me a reduction in standard rates. What a surprise to find this treasure at Daytona. Clean, clean, clean! We got an oceanfront room and enjoyed both sunrise and sunset views. The pool is large and clean clean clean! The only drawback is that all the beds are double beds...no queen-sized beds in the whole motel...but very comfortable. The location is convenient to restaurants and attractions at the beach. There is a new flat screen TV in the room, WiFi, a coffeepot, toaster, refrigerator, and a small stove. The rooms are well decorated as well as the hallways. We will be going back to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: Eva305
Reviews.Content: when i went a year a go it was ok. the rooms were clean and so was the bathroom. the only thing i didnt like was that they did something wrong with our booking we had booked the room for about 3 days and they put it for 2 days i think and on the third day we had to change to another room because they had booked our room for other clients that had asked for it. i really liked the first room it was a full view of the pool area and beach an so quite at night the only thing you could hear was the ocean waves. the balcony was clean. but then i got dissapointed when they moved us to the other room the third day because we didnt have a full view of the pool area or beach in order for us to see or hear the beach we had to go out on to the balcony witch by the way was a bit dirty but not so much. also i liked the fact that i was able to sit outside by the pool area and eat my breakfast with my family calmly while watching the beach and having a bit of breeze. the pool was waaaaaaayyyy tooooo cold and when the staff was notified they did nothing about it but they were very friendly though and one of the hot tubs wasnt working at all while the other one needed some cleaning but still was able to get in to and relax. at the end the things werent so bad an my family and me were able to enjoy it. oh and we went for march not sept.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: wcnormjv
Reviews.Content: Room.... It stunk we called for services it took two days for someone to come and change the paper in the cabinets and wasn't wiped down well and still stunk we just Glade sprayed it every day. They said they would try and give us a new room but it was full and there was nothing opened. Pool...... Black Algae and yes it was shut down for cleaning for two days while we was there and the health department was called out and shut it down. It was so nasty. Maid Service......they were polite and nice, but they didn't not have a working vacuum and the floors where always dirty. They did the minimum and I mean the minimum. They didn't even give extra toilet paper, we ran out and called down stairs and we waited. 30 minutes later front desk calls back and says if you want toilet paper come get it because they couldn't get a hold of the maid service. Hot tub.... Nasty and dirty and that is not a hot tub my neighbors have a better one then what they have. Balcony…. The air conditioner outside the room was broken and we had to keep our chair or table on it to keep it closed and it was dirty. Food…. Ha-ha that is funny they have it for breakfast and lunch but they closed early on some days when they was to be open till 3pm. It tasted good the day we did get to order it. The only thing I liked was feeding the stray kitty’s food and the view when I woke up every morning. We stayed for 11 nights from the middle of July to August 4th. We will not be staying here again and it wasn’t worth the price that you pay a night either and all the extra fees are just ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Pure Bliss”
Reviews.Author: Brian T
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed at The Acapulco Hotel and Resort. Our stay was nothing but perfect and quite accommodating to all of our unique and individual needs. We stayed for 4 days and 3 nights. Our room was extremely clean and our housekeeper was very friendly. One gentlemen who I personally met during my stay was David Simmons who I believe is the G.M. of the property. He was very polite, friendly, and professional. I would recommend this property to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation!”
Reviews.Author: lissakate79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked at Acapulco on Daytona Shores this year for the first time. After reading online reviews, I became concerned. We arrived early and were allowed to check in almost 2 hrs before normal check in! WE WERE PLEASANTLY SURPRISED that the reviews I read were wrong! Everything from beginning to end was a perfect touch to our vacation! The room was exactly as described online and very clean. We had #804, direct oceanfront room. The pool was not as descibed in other reviews, it was crystal clear, clean, and exactly like the photos for Acapulco on South Atlantic Shores. The restaurant in the hotel had excellent food and great prices, expecially the grilled chicken sandwich and fries! The bathrooms were clean & balcony was nice and relaxing. We did not have any interactions with staff other than check in/out which in both cases they greeted us with smiles and thank you's. The maids were very friendly and left plenty of coffee and towels whenever we needed. Everything that the hotel site said would be in our room was in our room, including everything needed in the kitchen. The internet worked great once I used the passcode supplied from the front desk for signing on. I would 100% stay here again and send friends/family here. I cannot imagine some of the other reviews on here being the same place I stayed at...I wonder if there's another Acapulco located somewhere else at Daytona? Anyway, the one on South Shores was perfect as far as we're concerned! The price for an oceanfront room was way cheaper than any other I checked on at Daytona. The pool and tiki bar were wonderful and ocean access was great from the deck!

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: smileytgirl2000
Reviews.Content: You name it.....it was terrible. Stayed here with my husband and 2 kids for 4 days in July 2012... The pool was DISGUSTING.....black algae, grime on the tile (my husband owns a pool care company)-we would not swim or let our kids swim. Gross... We brought it to their attention the first day and every day after, nothing was even attempted. We were told the pool needed resurfaced (which is crap) by every employee. We bookeda room with two queen beds....got two full beds, we were told queens do not exist and Expedia was wrong :-/ Room service was horrible or non existent...the hotel was always OUT of towels! Kitchenette was dirty, cookware that was prvoded was dirty. WI-FI never worked! TV worked sometimes Elevators Sooooooo slow that we always took the stairs..luckily we were only on the third floor! Not enough parking! Staff member told us "to write whatever review would make us happy" when we complained...so here ya go! I will never stay here again!!!! What a waste of a $500.00 hotel stay!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Clean!!!”
Reviews.Author: Xavier B
Reviews.Content: To be honest my family and I weren't expecting any 5 star service because we weren't paying any 5 star price. As an avid traveler I usually have an idea of what im getting for my dollar. I was actually expecting less, based on the price we paid. As i walked into the lobby the hotel was surpisingly clean!!! It didn't have the run down dirty feel that many hotels of this caliber in Daytona Beach has. The room was very clean, and well organized. I'm pretty familiar with Daytona being that I live in Orlando, and I like to keep up with the area, given that we come over at leat 3 times a summer to get away. I am impressed with the direction the new management is taking this property. I was suprised to find out that they served breakfast and lunch also. Although it's obvious that its a work in progress, given the fact that the young caucasion kid that cooked my food was the same one that delivered it. It was convenient to order a quick bite while heading out to the beach without having to leave the property. If you are looking for a quick trip to the beach and want to get the true bang for your buck i highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again..”
Reviews.Author: donna34678
Reviews.Content: Checked in on Wednesday 7/25/12, 2 nite stay. Not at all happy with this hotel and staff. When I checked in the first thing that was said to is . Where is your credit Card, not a hi or Kiss my foot or Welcome . Nasty staff. Got into the room floor not vaccum well, old carpet and drapes, windows need cleaning, change of bed linen every 3 days. 2 small cups of coffee was 4.28 i mean small cups. Go to the 7-11 cheaper. It says restort the only thing they had i guess they call a resort is a pool and it was not that clean. Small elevators very small. The T.V. kept reprogramming itself so you could not use the remote. I will never Stay at this Place Again... Ever. I have stayed at less expensive rooms in Daytona that was better then this place. Unhappy....in Florida

Reviews.Title: “Pictures on website very misleading!”
Reviews.Author: Rickey W
Reviews.Content: Pool was dirty, hot tubs were not running, lots of ware on facilities, no workout room. Website and Expedia mislead this vacation. We ere very disjointed upon arrival. We stayed here five years ago and it was wonderful, but things have really changed.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I expected.”
Reviews.Author: Kim K
Reviews.Content: I booked a room with a full size kitchen, and got one with a partial kitchen. When I went to the front desk to complain, they said they were booked and didn't have anything else to put us in. The toilet never stopped running. The room smelled of cigarette smoke. The phone didn't work. The elevators were horrible...we took the stairs. The balcony and room in general were pretty dirty. The only nice thing about the hotel is that it is right on the beach and the pool area was decent. When I was checking out there were about 3 people surrounding the desk with complaints. I definately would not recommend this hotel. It's not worth what they are charging to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Onegalstreasures
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a mom's get-away with some friends. We were very impressed with how professional the staff was from the moment we checked in. The front desk was very professional - there was a mix up with the room and they quickly got us squared away! We asked for an extra chair...and it was quickly delivered. The housekeeping stay was pleasantly friendly - always greeting us with a smile! I found the room to be very clean and the bed extremely comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “family vacation”
Reviews.Author: John S
Reviews.Content: one of my rooms toliet never worked Staff was friendly though. They advertised free breakfast NOT!!!!, no dish soap So far I was told one price and being charged another Air did not work sometimes. Jacuzzi hardly worked. Pool was dirty half way thru the day. This was my 3rd time there first 2 were great. But, new management has totally ruined this place by wanting to save the ol mighty dollar instead of pleasing the consumer.

Reviews.Title: “Needs a remodel !!!”
Reviews.Author: Mary L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights July 2012. The hotel is in a beautiful location if you have a room facing the north. You must ask for it at time of booking. There is no free breakfast. The room was small with two double beds. Carpet is very dirty. Bathroom is tiny and toilet did not flush until I called front desk to come a repair it. Rooms are not cleaned daily, only the towels are changed, beds are not made up. We had to ask for TP and hand soap. Two small elevators that are very slow! Pool is very small.

Reviews.Title: “Negitive 10”
Reviews.Author: Rickey G
Reviews.Content: I actually booked this room with the motel and could have gotten it cheaper thru Cheapostay, but I wanted a veiw on the North side. When I checked in, I ended up on the South side above the office. When I complained to front desk they asked me what the person name was where they could correct them for telling me I could get that side. Talked to the General Manager the next day about changing rooms and he said that they rented those to people who were only staying 1 or 2 nights as they would want a great view. We had booked for 6 nights. After three trips to the front desk trying to change rooms I gave up. We (family) have stayed there for the last 5 plus years booking at least 6 to 10 rooms. I will never stay there again and neither will any of my family members. I would suggest if you have a family with any kids try to find a good Hotel, I guess if you have more than 3 days to search you might find a worse hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Time at Acapulco, Beach Resort!”
Reviews.Author: AK_Consulting
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came for a romantic weekend, and we had a great time here! The hotel was conveniently right on the beach, which always helps us relax! There is a continental breakfast in the sit-down restaurant (with certain items that you can choose from) or you can select an optional "full breakfast" that you can pay for. I personally enjoyed the French toast. :) We were greeted and helped by a friendly staff, we enjoyed a beautiful balcony room which the hotel kept clean and fresh daily. There is a nice pool and deck-chair area, and even a shuffle board area! (I really wanted to play, but we ran out of time) :( If you are looking for a friendly, on-the-beach hotel in exciting Daytona, this hotel would do a great job for you!

Reviews.Title: “3's company”
Reviews.Author: Derek D
Reviews.Content: I live in Orlando but wanted to stay on the beach for a week... Found this hotel and read the reviews and some were good and some weren't but when I got there everyone was so wonderful and greeted us with a smile!!! Made us feel so welcome!! Our stay was awesome! We asked to switch rooms for a better view if they had something available... Called us back in 3 minutes and moved us with no problem... They even sent a front desk person up to help us move cause the bellman was already helping someone at the moment! I would give this place 6 stars if I could! Thank you so much for the wonderful time my family and I had there!!

Reviews.Title: “Great view, dirty linens.”
Reviews.Author: RelevantReviews
Reviews.Content: Disappointed with our stay. First, our room was not ready when we arrived. Second, the bed linens were stained and the blankets had holes in them. The beds are NOT queen sized as listed and there is no continental breakfast. There are only 2 elevators, both of which are extremely slow. On the positive side, the view was spectacular, the pool was nice, and overall the staff was friendly. If you are particular about cleanliness I would advise you to look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Motherof2kids2k6”
Reviews.Author: Ner F
Reviews.Content: I must say that this Hotel was not at all of what we expected, now we had booked the hotel months in advance and we read the reviews before booking but they were mixed reviews. So per our arrival we wanted to see the newer reviews and I must say some of the reviews were horrible which made my family and I kind of skeptical on staying. But when we arrived it was nothing of how the reviews made it seem. We stayed in an efficiency room (2 full bd, 1bth, kitchen, safe, private balcony which makes a big difference- with an awesome view right in front of you- on the beach). So we stayed 6days and 5nights all together. Now I must say there were some things that were promised but was not fulfilled- like for instance- Free in-room high speed Internet (does not exist) - Continental Breakfast (Does not exist) - Parking wasnt free (had to pay at the end of stay for us parking there daily - and you have to pay for the safe daily. Other than that, my family and I would give this HOTEL rating a good 4 1/2. The balcony view did it for us, waking up @ 6am (my mother in law) and seeing the sunrise and sunset was well worth it. Daytona Beach is for families looking to relax, shop, eat (same restaurants that you wld eat at hm, most of the restaurants had bars in them so if you have children dont go out at night), and enjoy the beautiful beach. If my family and I would go bk to Daytona Beach Shores, Acapulco Hotel & Resort (price was reasonable - this is not a Hilton not a Merriott) wld be the place for us. You guys keep up the work, b/c the staff was friendly, family orientated, & helpful (the ones we came in contact with).

Reviews.Title: “Unfair”
Reviews.Author: pocarles
Reviews.Content: I've booked a room for 2 adults and 3 kids but they gave us a room with 2 beds for 2. When I've asked for an additional bed (a rolling one actually), they charged me for this even if I've pais for 5 guest. At the end of the day, they finally told me they didn't have any rolling bed left so my son has to sleep directly on the floor of the room. The hotel was dirty, specially the bathroom. The bathtub was "brown" and the floor - where my son has to sleep - was suspect. The A/C unit was so noisy that I could not sleep more than 2 hours every night. I'll never go again in this hotel, where they don't give you what you paid for, don't find any solution to fix your problem and can't maintain clean the rooms and other common areas.

Reviews.Title: “A Piece of Paradise in Daytona Beach Shores”
Reviews.Author: ChiefNewJersey
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a hotel that had vacation and relaxation and found it at the Acapulco Hotel and Resort. When we first entered we knew right away we had found and outstanding resport. The lobby is great and you see the ocean thru the rear doors. Checking in the employees were extremely friendly and accommodating. Breakfast and lunch at the Resort restaurant were reasonable and delicious. During the afternoon we enjoyed cocktails at the Tiki Bar by the pool which overllooks the ocean. Room was clean and what a view from the balcony. We played miniture golf across the street and I let my wife win. The next time we travel to this resort it is going to be two weeks instead of one. Prices very reasonable for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great time for first time in daytona”
Reviews.Author: icatsyree
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from june 23-30th. We read the reviews and talked about changing, but decide we would just go ahead since the reviews were so mixed. We arrived that evening and had an easy time finding a parking spot. When we entered the room the family was completely happy with what we got. The room was clean and we had plenty of towels. The maid kept the room clean all week. The only thing wrong with the room is that the beds (comfortable pillow top) we full size beds and you have to cuddle to be able to share. (we are not sleep cuddlers so it got annoying a little). not having the continental breakfast sucked but the breakfast they have is affordable and delicious, and if you dont want to spend money on breakfast every day there is a grocery store right up the road and walmart not very far. the staff was extremely friendly and when there was no parking because they had two big tour buses parked there, they did not mind that we made our own parking spot. the only bad thing about the hotel is the hot tub. you could not turn it on the whole time we were there and it stayed pretty dirty. overall it was a great first impression for our first time to daytona, and it made my husband want to come back next year

Reviews.Title: “Not as advertised!”
Reviews.Author: dcomparetto
Reviews.Content: Our room was OK-bathtub had 3 rust marks very obvious and unattractive. My nephew had a huge problem with a manager, tyrying to get a lock on the door for his autistic child that did get out of the room. Called manager and he said there was nothing he could do and wouldn't even come to the room to look at the situation. If I'm not mistaken there is a ADA law in effect for this kind of situation. The group we had booked over 25 rooms and we all said we will not go back. I will give the cleaning staff an excellent review even though that manager treated some of the employees very badly. Would not recommend this hotel and resort to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “No continental breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Auntzeena
Reviews.Content: When we booked this trip the reviews said this hotel had great continental breakfasts. When we arrived we found that the continental breakfast has been discontinued and for an additional fee you can get 2 continental breakfasts per room and it consists of cereal, bread and coffee. This was not helpful for my family of 5. The location was nice, the pool was nice. The place was clean and the staff was friendly. Our room came with a kitchenette which was stocked with dishes, pots and pans and even a toaster. The pans were not non-stick so we got one at the Dollar store for 6 bucks and everything worked out fine. I highly suggest bringing your own non-stick pan if you have one of these rooms. Lol!

Reviews.Title: “VACATIONERS BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: PLUMBERLADY3
Reviews.Content: My family & I rented 3 rooms for the dates 6/09/12 - 6/16/13 .We could never get clean towels, they would not change our sheets because they say they did'nt have enough,was charged for internet service we never was able to use, 2 hot tubs & 1 worked 2 days ( but not very hot ). Oh let me tell you what I thought of the " professional chef ) ha!ha!. He yelled at me & my daughter because we questioned what we was told we could have for the so called free continental breakfast.He also stood in the main breeze way and screamed at a guest for a good 5 minutes. We asked the front desk to send the manager down but he never had the *#%@*& to confront any of the issues going on. The cook also accused a guest of stealing one of his plates in a room full of guest, that was also reported to front desk for manager.Manager was suppose to call me regarding these complaints ,but once agian nothing. We vacation in Daytona evey year for 35 years. This is the worst year ever. Also the elevators are soooo slow. If my husband did'nt have copd ( breathing problems ) we could have went to the 8th floor before it made it to 1 floor. I Do not want another family to have thier vacation ruined by the wrong impression." The Shores" since they bought it they should have made sure everything was functioning properly before they started taking reservations. What' so sad is we stayed here 2 years ago and it was great.I HAVE TO SAY THE WAITER TRIED VERY HARD.

Reviews.Title: “what a joke!”
Reviews.Author: velda a
Reviews.Content: we have been staying here for years but this year will be our last! we didn't get the room we wanted and we were told to live with it. I requested a roll away bed when I made the reservation and the same front desk clerk told me the hotel was out of roll-always and pillows and blankets. I have always payed the hotel bill when I checked out and I told the front desk not to put any charges on this card I always pay cash. What did they do? You guessed it, they charged everything the first day. This was a debit card and my paycheck had not cleared and I bounced money all over Daytona! Thank you for ruining my vacation and my bank account! I guess this hotel will go down the tubes just like so many hotels have in Daytona Beach because of terrible management! I will say that the housekeeping staff are all very nice and try to do their best.

Reviews.Title: “After 5 yrs., we won't be coming back.”
Reviews.Author: iamcrystal1
Reviews.Content: I understand cost-cutting and thrift, but it seems that the new management has lost sight of customer service and comfort. Immediately as I arrived, the front desk argued with me about my rate and coupon use before even looking at my reservation information. I don't have a problem with cutting out the free continental breakfast, but even low-end hotels have free coffee in the lobby ($2.00 a cup with a refill). No beach towels at 10:00am. Housekeeping is very short staffed. I found hamburger buns left by the previous occupants. I had to ask to have the room vacuumed, and had to look for the cart to get shampoo, coffee for the coffee maker and cups. Tub and sink were not even wiped out. I agree with the earlier comment that the carpets are very dirty. Good points: beautiful location and pool area. I'm going to miss the memories I have had over the years, but I won't be back.

Reviews.Title: “not a great place”
Reviews.Author: Lea O
Reviews.Content: we stayed here june 2012 carpet in room was filthy didn't get the room we were promised so gave a small kitchen to make up for it staff was very nice manager tried to make things right she didn't have much to work with 5.00 day to park which is just wrong that should be included in room rate small parking lot fills up fast no complimentary breakfast anymore never stayed in a hotel without free breakfast this was the first i would not stay here again for the price paid should have been alot more great view of ocean wifi worked great good location that's only good things i can say just don't go expecting alot the whole place bad need of renovations.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but not great!”
Reviews.Author: AleciaP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a week. The rooms were kept clean. We had the room with a kitchen, but there was only a "bar" area...no sit down table. The beds were somewhat small. Overall, the housekeeping did a good job keeping our room clean and refurnishing towels, etc. The parking lot is small and crowded...depending on how someone parks beside you, it could be difficult to get out of your space. The hotel is right on the beach, but your oceanview may be from the side. The biggest disappointment was the advertised "breakfast." When you walk in they have contential breakfast area; which is what we were expecting to have each morning. However, instead we were given a coupon and had to go the "restaraunt" to redeem it. The only choice was oatmeal and fruit. If you wanted anything else you had to pay $4 to upgrade. It was okay for us, but if a family came, this could quickly get steep compared to the other local hotels who do offer a free, good contential breakfast. I would consider this a hotel where you get what you pay for....Cheap prices for cheap accomodations. Not a horrible stay by any means, just not overly impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Would have to get much better to be awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lee B
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to give it any stars! What a nightmare! I consider myself a reasonable guy, not overly critical, but Daytona Beach was not a great place to go (nothing to do) and the hotel made it worse! I travelled from the UK to see the final shuttle launch with my daughter, a friend and his son. I've been to the states (NY and Florida) before and expected the usual US high standards. However, we would have settled for nothing more than hospitality and cleanliness, as it was really only a place to stay. On arrival at the Hotel, the receptionist was rude, which set the tone. It's true first impressions count. Our room was tacky with a dirty bathroom and cheap accessories. For example, the soap block all 5 mm x 5mm of it was stubbornly stuck to the plastic sink. The bed had a slightly damp squishy feel. I've stayed in better hotels at half the cost. My friend tried to play it all down as he didnt want to complain, but after I called the receptionist to inform her our room was not interconnecting as we'd asked, she was again rude. It wasn't what she said but it was the way she suggested she was speaking to an idiot that annoyed me. I tried to reason with her and finally she promised to check and call back if she could find another room but didn't. 30 minutes later I called her back to be curtly lectured she'd been busy dealing with the huge volume of other unlucky saps staying there. I have to say I didnt see more than 10 people. We (and this includes my friend who is very reasonable) decided we weren't spending 5k on hols to a place like that and the lack of atmosphere in Daytona Beach meant we left the hotel after 1 day and spent out on what was meant to be a cheaper place in International Drive. That hotel was in fact more classy with friendly staff. By the way we missed the Shuttle launch, it was rescheduled!! Take my advice, if you're booked in at The Acapulco then you should also reschedule, it won't send you into orbit!!

Reviews.Title: “Everything was Great at the Acapulco Hotel and Resort”
Reviews.Author: Jenny J
Reviews.Content: We had a really good stay! The hotel was well kept, clean, friendly staff, decently sized rooms, nice beds, excellant view, good pool with kids pool and excellant beach access. We ate at there on our first evening. The menu was not a huge menu but everything we ordered was good. We also had a couple of drinks from the bar that were good. We locked our key in our room one day and cleaning staff came up, let us in and checked our ID. Super friendly! It was right on the beach so we could walk right down to the beach or pool. It was nice to have the kitchen area in our room. Free WIFI that worked well. In the other reviews I read something about noise at night and we did not experience any of that. The only thing I can think to say negatively was that the elevators were slow. However, for a nice room, nice staff, nice place to stay, I couldn't care less about the elevators! We will stay here again if we go back to Daytona!

Reviews.Title: “One of the Worst Hotels in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: CCramer
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed with our stay in this hotel. The bedspread was dirty and there was hair on the floor in the bathroom and in the shower. It appeared as though our room was not thoroughly cleaned after the previous guest checked out. The advertised free WiFi did not work in the room or at the pool. I realized after we checked out of the hotel the next morning, that I left something in the room. I called back within an hour or two of checking out, and it took days to get an answer on whether they had my lost item. In addition to the delayed answer, it took two weeks for them to ship the item back to me. Their explanation of the delay was that they did not have a procedure in place for shipping left behind items to customers. There are far nicer places to stay in Daytona for the reasonable price that this dump offers. That was my first and last stay at this hotel, and I do not recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful family vacation”
Reviews.Author: Elsie M
Reviews.Content: I really can't say enough about this Resort. From the maintenance staff to the manager and everyone in between - they were all absolutely wonderful. Our room was an oceanview efficiency. The room was very clean, the kitchen well stocked and the beds were comfortable. The continental breakfast was great, but for only $3.00 you can upgrade to a great breakfast buffet. The pool area and the pool were well maintained. Our family will definitely return and will bring more people with us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons, But Great Price”
Reviews.Author: TippingEh
Reviews.Content: Paid $60 plus tax through Priceline's Name your Own Price. Building has rooms facing ocean and rooms on side of building, all with balconies. We were on the side and we still had amazing view. Upon check in we were assigned a room on the 2nd floor. Upon elevator exit the musty smell was obvious. Our room was small and had no kitchen. I later gathered that they are slowly renovating all rooms. I brought the smell up with the front desk staff and she was awesome. We were imediately upgraded to the 7th floor and a kitchen room, full fridge, stove top, dishes (only get these.......it was great.....brand new kitchen and bar area). Room 703. The floor upon elevator exit was fresh and smelled clean. The room once you went beyond the kitchen area was avg. The room was clean. If they switched out the beds I would give this property 4 stars for the price. The beds were a bit small for my husband and I but the linens were fresh. The a/c was new and worked great. Continental breakfast was basic and satisfying. Coffee, Juice, Bagels, Creams Chz, Muffins and Fruit. Pool area was nice, one jacuzzi was out of order but the other was nice. We weren't paying attention- you could walk from the pool area right onto Daytona Beach. Best View and Location. My guess is they reserve the priceline and discount rooms in un renovated areas. But mention nicely and they seem to upgrade you fast. For $60 and a full kitchen the value is unmatched. Give them another 6 months and we would return. Pros New Kitchen Amazing View Great Staff Clean Rooms Great Pool Beach Front Cons Full Beds Skimpy on the Blankets Don't be shy about pointing out an older room

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Bad Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shawna F
Reviews.Content: We were unable to sleep because throughout the night the pipes shook and made this very loud rumble in our room. The beds were only full size (not queen) so it was very cramped and there was only a thin bedspread, no blanket. We were charged for the rollaway we had to order because it was so cramped and get our own blankets and pillows. The free continental breakfast had fruit flies all over it. Nothing was covered. The bar closed at 8:30pm. One hot tub was boarded up. The other one could only fit a few people in it, so it was always full. The elevators were tiny and slow. We used the stairs to get to the 8th floor. Wifi didn't work, staff knew nothing about it. I felt bad for the staff, so many people were complaining about this hotel. Next time I will go elsewhere even though the view was spectacular. There was nothing quaint about this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Needs more renovations!”
Reviews.Author: TravelinFam74
Reviews.Content: The hotel exterior appears clean and well landscaped. The view and beach access are fabulous, but the Tiki Bar is one you may find in your backyard with no bar stools, music or atmosphere. The pool is nice, good size and 9ft deep- kids loved it! However, the jacuzzi's (one boarded up, the other from the 70's or 80's) were less than inviting. Free breakfast was decent and staff very friendly & accomodating. That's the good news, the bad news is the flooring, specifically carpeting is disgusting throughout the hotel. I will elaborate old, stained, not cut flush with the wall and in our room had an odor. The furniture coverings throughout the hotel are worn, stained and look like they have seen one too many spring breakers. Our room had an odor that no one could identify- my guess, mildew under the filthy carpet. This hotel has potential, but needs to finish renovations. Suggestion to management, move the dumpster away from balconies.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: hilsman
Reviews.Content: It was a quaint little ocean front hotel. The staff was nice and the rooms were adequate and clean. I was disappointed there was no Flat screen tv but the manger told me they were wirking on them. The pool was great and there was a small tiki bar. My room was directly ocean front. I would come here again. I wish they had room service!

Reviews.Title: “A tale of 2 rooms”
Reviews.Author: Michael G
Reviews.Content: Overview: The property is located in a quiet area . At times there were very few people using the beach...say 2 people per every 100 yards. The beach is hard pack so vehicles drive on it, there is soft sand near the hotel pool entrance. The pool is nice and during the week very quiet. The continental breakfast is rather sad, bagels, bread ,juice, muffins mixed fruit and coffee. Good news here-just across the street is Mike's Galley and they serve a good breakfast and lunch. About 3/4 mile north is an Ihop and a few yards further is a Winn Dixie where you can buy Fixin's for anything you want. About 2 blocks south is a New York bagel place with very good pastries.The problem is dinner ... the closest restaurant is Ihop again and right across the street is a Best Western which looked pricey. The top of Daytona is a restaurant with 4-6 early bird specials (starting at $14) and a phenomenal 29th floor view of the beach and the city. There are also buses and trolleys right outside the door to take you in any direction....Bus schedules available in the lobby. The front desk clerks are exceptional and helpful. Now about the rooms I was first in room 218 which overlooked the fire pump room and an open (lid was never closed) garbage cart. Birds were plentiful and the view was somewhat obstructed by a white fence, the parking lot, and the property next door. The room was very quiet, I even felt I might be the only one on the floor. A plus also was the flight of stairs that took you to the lobby which allowed you to avoid the slow old elevators. I give this room a 3 star rating. Room 802...I asked to be switched to an OCEANFRONT room because the hotel was so empty. They readily agreed. The view is why the room gets a 1 star rating. The view is all it had going for it. What was wrong:There was ahorrible sound which was akin to a dinosaur with indigestion. It was not continuous, but it went off and on . I later found this to be "the pipes"./ The patio/porch had cigarette butts on it/ the closet had trash in it from a previous guest/ the floors had food stuffs on them most notably in the corners/ I saw a cockroach in the bathroom...8th floor Really?/ the silverware was sticky and dirty in the drawers/the beds were saggy/and very scary it looked like the wiring was overloaded and not fully plugged in. I never heard a vacuum being used on this floor. Strangely enough the room had upgraded soaps in it. This room had a mini fridge instead of a full size as in room 218. I know I could have all of these things addressed, but I wanted to see what was done on their own. I usually have the do not disturb sign up as I am a writer and do not want to be disturbed, but I did have service in 802 and it was make beds/empty waste baskets and add new towels only... would I stay here again ? Not Likely.stayed 04/21-29

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO THERE”
Reviews.Author: Frankie1964Ireland
Reviews.Content: My family booked the hotel through Virgin Holidays in England and we were expecting the quality you would associate with Virgin but the hotel was a disaster from start to finish. The first room we were allocated had not been serviced the first thing we noticed were half eaten bagels on the floor the room had not been duster or hoovered and there was a half empty bottle of Coke in the fridge from the last guests then on checking the beds the sheets on one on the beds were stained. We complained and were told we could move to another room but it was very late so we stayed the night and were moved the next morning to another room which we were told had a cleaning blitz for us. The 2nd room was no better we found cotton buds and a contact lense on the floor and cookies under the bed, the sink was dirty and I wouldnt like to think how long it was since the room was hoovered of dusted. The dust was thick on the headboards and the worktop in the kitchen was not cleaned. The room was sold by Virgin as a room for 5 people but there was no space to accommodate 5 people we had one chest with 2 full size drawers and 2 half size drawers and the wardrobe had 5 hangers we had to live out of our suitcases fot the week. The room was not hoovered or dusted for the week, the mirror in the bathroom was never cleaned and the roll out bed was not made some of the days. The air con was so loud we could not leave it on at night. I would not recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Tried to make the best of it.......”
Reviews.Author: SouthDakotaLee
Reviews.Content: We booked this off of Priceline. The pictures on the website are very deceiving. I started to worry a few days before our trip when I checked the hotel website and saw the recent negative reviews, but was still optimistic, until we actually arrived. I wanted to cry when I saw the rooms. We had booked 2 rooms because we have a family of 6. I assumed we would have adjoining rooms for the kids, nope. When I asked about this I was told I could check back the next day after 11:00. I said that would not be an option as we had plans in the Orlando area for the day and would be gone well before that time. Asked if she would let me know if something came available and she never did so I assumed nothing opened up. When we checked out 5 days later the gentleman that checked us out asked why our rooms were so far apart and why they didn't get us closer? I said I asked the same thing and he just said that it was "strange". So for 5 nights we had 2 rooms on different floors and could not be together as a family. That was just the start. Like I said as soon as I saw the condition of the room I wanted to leave, but being Priceline we were stuck unless we wanted to shell out even more money. We went to the nearest strore and purchased Lysol to spray all over carpet and bedspreads. Shower curtains had mold, used lysol on that too. All in all hotel is VERY dated with only lobby area remodeled and outside of hotel. Rooms and hallways need new carpet BAD. I cannot stress that enough. Stairwells need paint and elevators need total overhaul. You can hardly get the luggage carriers in them without getting stuck. I will be notifying Priceline of this hotel. The maintenance and housekeeping staff were very friendly. There is no way this hotel should be recognized as 3 stars however. The beach was nice. Pool O.K. Hot Tub not working correctlly and looked dirty. Beds comfortable but bedspreads had stains. You just did not dare leave anything on the floor or even want to walk on it, it was that dirty. We stayed gone alot and tried to be outside and only inside when we had to sleep. A/C worked well but loud. Like I said, tried to make the best of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: STACII28
Reviews.Content: The Hotel staff were great anything I needed they got for me right away this hotel was great for the price I had a great view of the ocean the room was clean and nice.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: lisa a
Reviews.Content: You walk Inn the lobby it's very nice until.... Theres two elevators that are VERY SLOW...MY kitchenette had crumbs on the counter the dishes were dirty the tile/ curtain in the bathroom were stained NO Fans in the bathroom, bug underneath my mattress. The ocean view was great the a/c worked great! the pool was nice but warm one of the hot tubs didnt work . Continental breakfast was ok the first morning no muffins there was no butter, the toasters were crappy! Theres was many stray cats including one with 3 legs.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go back”
Reviews.Author: HoosierTraveler33
Reviews.Content: I made a reservation with Travelocity and when I arrived at the front desk for check-in they did not have my reservation. We waited 30 minutes for them to find it before receiving a key to our room. When we finally made it up to the room we checked our sheets and although the beds were made, the sheets and pillow cases were very dirty. I called the front desk and no one came up to take care of the problem. In disgust, I took the pillows down to them and they promptly replaced them. The coffee pot had old coffee in it from a previous occupant. The elevators are extremely slow and breakfast was never the same time every day (checked at 6:30 am and there was still no coffee). I think my garden hose puts out more water than their shower. Overall a terrible experience and I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Unhappy”
Reviews.Author: Sarah R
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel early to spend the day by the pool and on the beach before our official check in at 4:00. As we checked back it became clear that 4:00 was a firm check in time. So, we waited and enjoyed the beach. At 4:00 we returned and found a line almost reaching out of the front door. We waited in line for apporximately 20 mins and were then told that our room was not ready. The staff blamed it on all the bike week check outs. They offered no more accomodation to me and my family than to sit and wait in the lobby. By 5:00 my 4 year old had just about had enough of the waiting and needed place to clean up. We asked for the staffer to check our room status and we were told to get back in line. Once we reached the counter and gave her our name again, she responded with,"Oh yes, your room has been ready for quite some time". It would have been nice for her to have let us know. Just as we stepped onto our floor the house keeping attendant stops us and says, "Don't freak out there aren't any towels in your room. I'll bring them up a little later." Really??? don't freak out!! All I want at this point is a shower for me and my little one. So, again we wait. At 6:45 I call to get the update on towels and they assure me they will be right up. 7:15 no towels. 7:30 we go downstairs to have a chat. They find some pool towels to hold us over, which would have been fine in the first place. We didn't get new bath towels until the next day at 3:20. The room was fine. Decently clean and had a farily well equipped ktichenette. The free breakfast offered is toast, bagels, and cereal. Nothing really to speak of. The pool was nice, very large and heated. The jacuzzi's were a joke. The one opperating jacuzi barely had any water in it at all and that water was murky and gross. The walls of the jacuzzi were also terribly dirty. Online it stated there was a bar on the pool deck, again that was nonexistant. At our checkout the staffer stated she would need to collect a PARKING FEE of $5 a day. This is what I find completely obscene. You have charged me a room fee already, now my car has to pay for it's space outside. Luckily after all the check in and towel shannanagins they waived that fee. We tried several time to speak with a manager, but they were never available. Needless to say my family and I will not be staying here again. There was one front desk staffer that was abesolultely wonderful and I wish I could remember her name, but she checked us out and was very accomodating and understanding.

Reviews.Title: “Would not recommend.”
Reviews.Author: Andrew M
Reviews.Content: We stayed during bike week, and found very few positive things to say about this hotel. We paid around $230 per room per night (4 people, 2 nights, 2 rooms). Neither of the rooms we had were very clean on arrival - we found stains on the furniture and hair on the bathroom floor. The fittings in the bathrooms were not firmly attached (tap not firmly attached to the sink and shower head not firmly attached to wall). The towel rail broke when the plasterboard anchors came out of the wall. The exhaust fan was very loud and rattley. The air conditioner was also very noisy, but was functional. The TV in the room was CRT (which seems very dated in 2012). Kitchenette had pots and pans but no plates. Internet was free (positive), but rather slow. Did not visit the restaurant, pool or bar. Front desk staff were friendly, which was a positive. This hotel really needs to be renovated it can command the kind of price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “OK, for Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: Moscoman57
Reviews.Content: Staff was exceptional. Great attitude and very friendly. Had an issue with the AC and it was fixed within 10 minutes. Hotel is pretty decent but carpet in room was yicky....made you want to keep your socks on. Was there a couple days ago for Bike Week start. Still have tube TVs which certainly are not as sharp a picture as what we now expect. They brought out bike towels to wipe down our bikes. I did not take advantage of their breakfast because right accross the stree is a restaurant that offers the best breakfast in Daytona....believe me on this!! AC in room was fine..type that lets you set the temp and doesn't keep waking you up. Keep in mind there are a lot of crap hotels in Daytona and this one is one of the better ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BradentonTom
Reviews.Content: Hotel is on the beach in one of the better areas. The property could use a renovation but the prices are value oriented. Came to Daytona on the week of Daytona 500. We did not use the free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “nice”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: The extremely helpful staff went above and beyond when we arrived a day early. Everyone here is super friendly. This hotel is very clean. They have a great pool and hot tub. The parking was free, that was definitely a plus

Reviews.Title: “Well its on the beach”
Reviews.Author: Kim L
Reviews.Content: Ashley & Will, Front Desk Clerks and Sylvestor, Maint. are very helpful and professional. Advertised 2 jacuzzis, one hasnt worked in over a year per Mgr, Morgan, the other is so small and it was always full(6 adults max) so advertised 2 jacuzzis only had 1. Air didn't work had to get maintenance to come in to work on it because there was no other rooms, 3 TV remotes we went through to get one that finally worked, every night had to ride around to find a parking place that we were charged a daily fee for. Charged $1.50 a day fee for a safe we told them we did not need and when we checked out got charged .99cents each for each LOCAL phone call. NOWHERE was this listed, not on the phone or at check in but we got charged and who charges for local phone calls? NEVER will we stay here again, it is a CON, RIP OFF

Reviews.Title: “If your not picky it's good”
Reviews.Author: scalderin2
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location , the price is great for a ocean Jew and balcony. The rooms weren't that clean, there were stains on the floor and mold in the shower but again for the price if you aren't picky it's great. The staff was amazing ashley checked us in and she was so nice and quick, durin our free continental breakfast the staff walked around and talked to all the guest, it was a nice experience. The beach is beautiful the hotel is small but has a pool spa and a lounge are ! Very nice for the price !

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous incidentals and parking charges at this money-grubbing hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joy S
Reviews.Content: This was supposed to be a 3-star "resort" that we looked forward to visiting. We suspect them of "Priceline Punishment" meaning that if you booked through Priceline, you were automatically charged for things that other guests were not charged for and given the room closest to the elevator. Their "incidentals" charge was $50.00 a night and they charged $5.00 parking per night even though the parking lot was nearly deserted as was the entire town. Such parking expense could be justified during busy periods but it seemed ridiculous under the circumstances. The final straw was when they charged TAX on the parking! These arbitrary incidental charges seem immoral if not illegal and it is my feeling that hotel goers should stand up against them. What stops the hotels from charging $200.00 a night incidentals? Whatever they charge is money that vacationers can't use while on vacation. These charges are imposed arbitrarily without any opportunity to negotiate or agree to the charge beforehand. The hotels should be required to find some other way to protect their investment - that is there responsibility, not mine. Besides these primary concerns were other reasons that I would not consider this a 3-star "resort". There was mold on the shower curtain and shower walls and the shower rod was rusty. The "breakfast" left a lot to be desired. The check-in person wouldn't throw water on you if you were on fire and as a whole, it was simply an unfriendly place.

Reviews.Title: “Very accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Diana B
Reviews.Content: We came into Daytona for a family emergency..I needed a hotel that was reasonably priced and preferred on the beach because we were going to have a lot of "down" time...so we thought. There were 3 of us...brothers and sisters. The staff could not have been more polite or concerned...but especially "Will"...he was wonderful. They helped us get a very reasonable rate for the second night, which was last minute and unexpected. They upgraded us to a "suite" overlooking the ocean. Two negatives...no counters, desks or anything to spread out, and only double beds. I had to sleep with my sister and it was snug. (There were cots for rent, but we declined)..Other than that...it was terrific and will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Coral Princess”
Reviews.Author: Reen8
Reviews.Content: In Feb. 2011 we took a 10 day cruise on the Coral Princess. What an amazing experience. We have never cruised before and we absolutely loved it. Our cruise was through the Panama Canal. We had a balcony room that was fantastic. We felt so pampered throughout the whole 10 days. If you want to just sit back and relax and have someone care for your every need cruising is the way to go. We loved every minute and the staff could not do enough for you. What a great experience, we hope that someday we will be able to go on another great cruise. If you've always wanted to try one and been a little afraid of doing so, don't be afraid. It is one of the best vacations we have ever had. Truly outstanding in every way. Each port was a new adventure. Our first port was Jamaica and we went to the Dunsriver Falls. It's like heaven on earth. A must see place. I can't speak for any other cruise line but Princess was more than we imagined.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, but off of "beaten" path”
Reviews.Author: kingsrattler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through pricelines "Name your price", and this hotel has been my only bad experience with Priceline's tool. For what was billed as a "3 Star hotel" this criteria it does not meet. It was outdated, and seemed just like a beat up hotel. It is more than a walk's distance from the boardwalk, and the pool left much to be desired. In summary, it was not a bad hotel, but not what you expect when booking a 3 star resort hotel on the beach front.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Very Nice Staff!”
Reviews.Author: SheaRod11
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had just come off a cruise at Port Canaveral and wanted to spend a few night in Florida before heading home to South Carolina. I booked the Acapulco hotel through Travelocity as a "mystery hotel." The room we were put in when we first arrived was on the second level, closest room to the road, so there was the smallest of ocean views. My wife was not happy as this was our honeymoon and she had hoped for something a bit nicer. Being the good husband I am, I went down to the lobby and waited patiently as another guest was checking in to ask if there was any other room available. I was sure there was because it seemed like we were the only ones at the hotel. The manager (Morgan) came in and asked if she could help me. I asked if there was anything available with a better view and she checked the computer to see if there was anything and informed me there would be an upcharge for an ocean front room. As she was checking,the nice lady that orginally checked us in whispered to Morgan that we were on our honeymoon. So, instead of charging us for an upgrade, she glady gave us an ocean front suite at no extra-charge. I couldn't believe it! The stay was great! Every staff memeber was friendly. Our room was nice, large, comfortable, and had an awesome view! The ONLY complaint I had was the A/C. I'm a light sleeper so everytime it cut on and off, I woke up. Other than that I would just like to say thank you again to Morgan and everyone else at the hotel who helped make our stay in Daytona a very pleasant experience!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Greg D
Reviews.Content: Best deal in town! This is our second time staying here. The lobby is very nice, Check-in was fast. There is a bar, and during the day, poolside service! All the rooms have a ocean view, the accomdations are are good, we had two full beds, full kitchen, with stove, microwave, and toaster. The only problem we had was the remote didn't work but Paul from maintenance reprogramed it, he was very nice and even offered to make reservations for us when i told where we were going to eat diner. All the staff is very friendly, and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “So-so....”
Reviews.Author: Stephaniekowalski
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a weekend trip, and decided to stay here after reading decent reviews. The hotel wasn't terrible, but it wasn't great, either. The lobby was very nice and check in was a breeze. The elevators are VERY slow, especially when you're staying on the top floor. Our room was the part we were disappointed by the most. The floors were yucky feeling and the bathroom just didn't sleep clean. We had a problem with our tub draining, but I will say they were quick to get someone up to fix it. Our view was decent. The one saving grace to this hotel is their awesome pool area. The pool is 9 1/2 feet deep, and very large. On a scale of 1-10, I'd give this hotel a 5.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stacy B
Reviews.Content: I love this place so much! This is my second time staying here. The breakfast it very good,it is in a great location,has fun places to eat and play right across the street. The staff was very nice....Loved the bartender Nikki....she was super funny! The front dest workers were also very nice! Pools were very clean....the kids loved the kiddie pool!!! One hot tub was out.....but it was last year also. .....Still loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great value.”
Reviews.Author: Suncat727
Reviews.Content: Very clean, great locaton. Bartender was very friendly, but the rest of the staff were kind of rude. Room had a modern kItchenette, comfy beds. Big pool, easy access to beach. Had two teenage boys with us who were disappointed with the breakfast, but we were overall VERY happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Will never return to that hotel again!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Patricia D
Reviews.Content: My vacation started off with me arriving before the rest of my group, when we called a year in advance to set up the reservation we were told that we would all be on the same floor so that all the kids could be together, we also asked to be on the 5th floor or above, When I got there, I was told I was on the second floor, when I asked about the rest of my party I was told that they did not have a floor or location for them and that they would not be able to get me with them on the same floor because of other guests already being booked. I asked to speak to the manager and the girl behind the counter was very rude and said that she was not in and did not know when she would be in. The next day they did fix it so the rest of the party were all together and I had to wait another day and then get moved with them on the same floor, which meant moving all my stuff a second time. I also told them that the light in the bathroom in the room I was in was flickering really bad and needed to be changed before it went out and she said she would have maintenance go up and fix it, it never happened the 2 days I was in it, the light never got fixed. I thought the continental breakfast was bad, I went to the store and bought stuff for my room so that I could have something good to eat before going out on the beach. I thought that the service was horrible, and the girls behind the counter were rude and just didn't care about the visitors. I got the impression the only thing that matters to them is the money coming in and not if the guest are happy. I was at the hotel for 9 days and not once while I was there did they clean the pool. When asked about it we were told that someone was bringing in the equipment and would have it cleaned., Well that never happened while I was there. The hotel was not clean, everyday when they came to clean the rooms it seemed like they never had the towels to replace in the bathroom, they always had to come back with them,. If you asked for pool towels it was like pulling teeth to get some, they would say you have some in your room. Yes we did have some but once we used them and need clean ones we could not get any without a hassle. The hallways stunk bad, I had to use them a few times because the elevators were so slow and got tired of waiting for them, I had to hold my breath and walk fast down the stairs because it was horrible. I thing the $5 parking per day for guest is crazy, I have never had to pay to park at a hotel when I was a guest. I have come to Daytona Beach for years every August and this is the first bad experience I have ever had. I can't wait to be able to go back next year and stay at the hotel we usually stay at and enjoy myself. The only reason I did not stay there this year is because it was being renovated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice ocean view from EVERY room; convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: motorboat46560
Reviews.Content: The rooms in this hotel were very nice and had many convenient features such as a mid-sized fridge, a stove, a microwave, and many others. This hotel is also conveniently located within range of tourist attractions such as the Daytona Speedway, Disney World, the Kennedy Space Center, and SeaWorld. There are many great places to eat out at as well as to order pizza delivered from in the area as well. The continental breakfasts are great and full of fresh food. My only problem with this hotel was that the WiFi was slow and wasn't working very well.

Reviews.Title: “we will NEVER be back”
Reviews.Author: skip c
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 11 nights, only because the place we usually stay at was renovating their hotel. The place was very dirty, smelled like bug spray everywhere you went in the hotel. The breakfast was not good at all. For a non smoking hotel the hallway where our room was smelled of cigarette smoke. If you have anything valuable you would be better off leaving it in your car because they steal from the rooms. When we reported it all they had to say was "call the cops". They did nothing about it. The manager avoided us after that. For 3 days I tried to talk to her and all I was told was that she was in a meeting. We had to pay $5 a day for parking while outsiders came and parked for nothing and used the pool and the restrooms. Again nothing was done about that. We got there on a Saturday and the pool was filty. After 5 days of never being cleaned I asked the manager if they were going to vacuum the pool and she said a new company was coming in that day and they should be cleaning it soon. We left 7 days after that and the pool was never cleaned. The employees at the front desk were ruder than rude. Our room was dirty, the rug was nasty.

Reviews.Title: “"We loved it and we'll be back!!"”
Reviews.Author: Taxmom8833
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel accomodations online and hotel matched online description. Great cont. breakfast each morning. Room cleaned and restocked each and every day. Hotel staff very welcoming and helpful. Oceanfront room---excellent view of Beach and Pool. Very Clean. Bohemian Bar offering poolside drinks 4 - 5 days a week. Very Satisfied. Will refer to friends and family. Great value!! We will be back!!! Loved our stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Value”
Reviews.Author: Saluki7
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Acapulco multiple times over the years. This used to be a big hotel until all of the condos moved in, but still for the money it is a good deal and great quiet location. For all of those who complain about it, you are paying less than $100 night for on the ocean and yes it is not an Iberostar or Dreams, but it does the job. The pool is good, maid service was good / had my room cleaned by 11am every day and the breakfast is good (nice people working there and really friendly). I enjoy the area and on the beach there is a rental vendor and food vendor right near the hotel. I would stay again and had a great time there with no problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: lnkelty13
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great and we met alot of great people while on vacation. The only complaint I have is that my daughter got injured the first night we were there. The stones in front fall on her foot and sliced her toe wide open I should of got stitches in her toe but she didnt want to go to hospital but I got home Sunday night and her toe is horrible and has a doctor appointment today. I would just advise that the rocks,stones arent so loose where they fall on guest feet.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely Need to Be Improved”
Reviews.Author: TOMYS
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great location with direct access to the beach. The room was dark and small for two double beds. The two elevators are really slow and small for the luggage carts. The door to our room was misaligned; could not close completely unless you lifted the door. Because of that, we didn't feel safe. The bathroom was very small. The tub drain was clogged and management did not fix the problem after we complained. Breakfast food was OK; the gentlemen working the breakfast bar was great and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good except for fire alarm at 3am”
Reviews.Author: luvthesun33
Reviews.Content: We had a room on the 3rd floor so we were lucky enough to not have to use the elevator. The room had a full sized refrigarator, two burrner stove top,microwave, pots,pans,ect. Like a mini kitchen. The view was nice and the beach was wonderful. Also soaps shampoo were not the average crappy kind. The pool was unclean & full of sand, but it's right on the beach so thats kinda expected. The hot tubs were gross. A teen pulled the fire alarm at after 3am so I was bolted awake by a piercing siren. I grabbed up my two daughters & went flying down the stairs, as my husband helped two older women down the stairs. When I reached the lobby the front desk was screaming everything was OK (false alarm) but we went outside anyway because the alarm was still going off and it was Loud. Outside there where teens & staff laughing about the situation that I did not at all find the least bit funny. On a good note if there was a fire there the alarm could raise the dead. Oh, and wonderful sunrises.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE PLACE, BUG INFESTED, & MANAGEMENT IS UNPROFESSIONAL!”
Reviews.Author: beautifulface
Reviews.Content: I must say that I am highly disappointed by my stay at this place for my birthday weekend. We planned to stay in Daytona for two days at this place then drive to another part of Florida for the remaining vacation. We knew the hotel was cheap but it was like being stick in the twilight zone of the 1970's. This place needs immediate upgrades and is infested with bugs. You have to pay to park each night in the tiny parking lot although there may not be enough space available to park. Morgan the manager is horrible and lacks professionalism. I had a problem where the air conditioner leaked on all of my things and caused mildew. Morgan did not care and got smart with me when I asked for her supervisor. Let my photos speak for themselves, this place is terrible and not worth one penny.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK...”
Reviews.Author: AandM2005
Reviews.Content: We had an ocean front room that was a bit small to be considered a suite, but it did have a kitchenette which was nice. The room was a bit outdated, but very clean. The beach was nice, not very crowded near the hotel. The pool was nice and the baby pool was clean, but the gates near the pools didn't lock so our little ones could run right in before us. Although the room was well kept, the grounds were not. There was trash under the steps by the pool and under the steps leading to the beach. The free breakfast that was included was well stocked although it had minimal options. The man in charge of that was very nice and would get anything that was missing for you.

Reviews.Title: “Somewhat pleased with the accommodations and staff and we'll stay again in the future!”
Reviews.Author: vpmcdaniel
Reviews.Content: Staff was very friendly, especially the man who worked the breakfast bar. He went out of his way to be nice to people. Oceanview efficiency was a great choice. Minimal kitchen utensils in room so bring your own. Room clean. Only problem was the airconditioner leaked on the carpet and the floor was very wet on one side of the room most of the stay. Maintenance was quick to respond to the problem. No restaurant open on premises except for buffet continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Value Yes - Management No”
Reviews.Author: InstaManager
Reviews.Content: Every July 4th I travel to a different beach around Florida with a few friends. This year I chose an oceanfront room at the Acapulco Hotel and Resort. My specific requests were Oceanfront - Balcony - Non/Smoking - Poolside Bar. I was disappointed to find out not only did they not setup the outside Tiki Bar for July 4th weekend - they didn't open this indoor bar until 4 PM on Saturday and 1PM to 6PM on Sunday, closed on Monday July 4th. The continental breakfast is exactly that. Nothing more nothing less. My room was definitely a room that had been smoked in before. Horrible smell. The elevators here take forever! Here is a list of Pro's and Con's - you decide what matters most for your vacation. Pro's 1. Oceanfront - Location 2. Nice Lobby 3. Only $5 a day for parking. 4. Oceanfront Pool 5. You can get Oceanfront rooms in peak season for $200 a night or less off Priceline. Con's 1. Spa is was dirty - unusable. 2. Elevators take at least 4-5 minutes to get to your floor (8 Floors total) 3. Staff seemed unorganized. 4. Bar will close early and open late. 5. Lots of kids - not ideal for adults 25+ looking to socialize and have a good time. 6. Room service barely touched room during stay.

Reviews.Title: “Nice pool great location but bad staff”
Reviews.Author: randybgky
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly located, in good condition and maintained in average condition. The continental breakfast was nice and breakfast staff were great. The pool is very nice and the maintenance staff was good. The concierge was very nice and helpful. Very friendly. The front desk staff, with the exception of Barbara seemed very put out that I was there. Not very pleasant or attentive. The housekeeping staff was HORRIBLE. They were rude, angry, hateful and that's being nice. Attitude and smart comments behind our backs. Granted I wasn't there for the housekeeping but it sure made it uncomfortable. Whatever you do, do NOT leave anything at the hotel because you will not like trying to get it back. Probably would not return simply because of service.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it here and cant wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: nancy4551
Reviews.Content: We just love the acapulco Hotel.. hats off to amanda at the front desk and keith at the buffet bar..our room was great and the view of the ocean was outstanding.. we cant wait to go back..the general manager morgan garves, really know how to motivate her staff.. they really care that your visit is wonderful...thank you all at the acapulco...

Reviews.Title: “Not a resort, a motel with a pool”
Reviews.Author: Mommyof
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was disgusting, floors were nasty, the beds were dirty, lights in the room were out and it was staffed by 1 very nice lady. Much more like a motel

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, nice view”
Reviews.Author: Mamiricura
Reviews.Content: If you planning to stay here make sure to pay a little extra and ask for an Oceanfront room. The rooms are bigger and very clean. Room service is great, people have courtesy with the guests. Well maintenance in the property. Just 2 things to point out, the breakfast does not have many choices, at least everything is fresh. Also internet is kind of slow or non working if you are on 8Th floor. Good location, close to IHOP and other restaurants, stores and grocery store. Our room has a little kitchenette. Overall the stay was very satisfactory. there is a parking charge, but don't worry is just a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Not hard to please, this was just bad”
Reviews.Author: Wesley_4024
Reviews.Content: Pros- close to beach, patio was nice, away from the hustle and bustle if you are looking for that kind of vacation like myself....could be a con if not. The swimming pool was fairly nice Cons- Elevator was amazingly slow....ridiculous. Everyone we came in contact with complained also. We thought it was just us to begin with. If you decide to stay, ask for the 1st floor. Bathrooms were nasty. They advertised they spent a ton of money on renovations. Apparently, all the renovations were cosmetic. There are new lamps, furniture, etc. However, our tub is absolutely disgusting. My wife spent over an hour scrubbing it. Since on the topic of disgusting, upon arriving at the room, the room had not been vacuumed (still sand on the floor from previous vacationers), crumbs on the countertops and the floors look nasty as well as the beds. In most cases, I would have backed out and went elsewhere. However, we had been wrestling with our 2 year old on the trip down and were ready for a break. I'm not our to bust Acapulco's chops, but unless you're looking for a hotel close to the beach and cleanliness doesn't matter, you might want to take a pass on this one The wifi internet built in did not work to begin with. I was instructed to call a 1-800 number, for which I was held on hold for over 30 minutes before getting some help.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation !!”
Reviews.Author: BSievers_11
Reviews.Content: This makes the second year that my son and I stayed at the Acapulco and I can pretty much assure a return next summer. Since he's outgrown the Amusement parks we've been going to the beach and this place offers all that we need. Both years we've had a 5th floor oceanfront room and the view is beautiful. I even got up early a couple of mornings to watch the sunrise over the ocean (breath taking!) I read some of the reviews before we booked here the 1st time and feel that some people are a bit too picky. This is not a 5 star hotel, but it's more than a legit 3 star. As some of the reviews said,"there's some sand on the pool bottom", Well duh, the pool is 10 feet from the beach!. "The elevators are a little slow" . I timed it and our longest wait was 3 minutes (It's an 8 story hotel). The room was clean, the desk staff was helpful and friendly, the pool was clean, what do some people want? The location is great, it's on the south end of Daytona Beach which is the quieter area, the beach as I said is mere steps from the pool, and the have vendors that set up right behind the hotel and a lifeguard usually on duty. And if that's not enough, if you want a real breakfast Mike's Galley is right across the street (excellent breakfast, I'll be giving them a real good review as well). Also if you like Minature Golf - Hawaiian Falls, also right across the street, has 2 courses and an all day rate that goes until 11 PM, not 5 PM like most of the ones in town. Fine hotel, good stuff nearby, what more could you want for a relaxing vacation? We'll be back !!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: stacy7380
Reviews.Content: We were only able to stay for one night, but this was a wonderful hotel! The front desk staff were the friendliest and most helpful I've ever met. They allowed us to check in by 12:30, the rooms were comfortable, and the view was fantastic! Value was excellent! Our only complaint was that the hot tubs were out of order, which seems to be a common problem among many hotels I've stayed at in Daytona. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, decent place!”
Reviews.Author: SandyKMichigan
Reviews.Content: I can understand some of the bad reviews this place has received....but for my sister and I, the Acapulco was just fine! This hotel shows its age, and although the lobby area looks quite nice, the rooms could use new carpeting, etc....we had a bit of trouble one day getting our doorwall to close because the tracks were somewhat corroded....the maintenance guy came quickly with some WD-40, and we had no trouble after that....we slept fine, even though the AC unit was quite loud and goes on intermittently...the continental breakfast is just 'OK', it sufficed when we didn't care to go out to breakfast....I think the location is great, and the ocean view is a big plus!! All of the employees we had contact with were frinedly and helpful....I would say that if you aren't picky, and want to be on the ocean without spending an arm and a leg, the Acapulco is the place for you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, breakfast buffet good, friendly gentleman on buffet staff.”
