Reviews.Author: SueCApopka
Reviews.Content: Pay the extra to check out later so you can stay longer. pool area very nice, hot tub too hot couldnt get in it. convenient to everything including dennys and fast food less than 3mins down the road. Overall nice. would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: isillyme
Reviews.Content: I spent a ditch the hubby weekend, and I must say I really had a relaxing time. The front desk was very helpful.. They let me check in a couple of hours early and after a very long drive being able to check in early was downright needed. The I internet connection is very very bad, and if you position the laptop just right you may have 1 bar of service. The bartender makes a fabulous Fruit punch Daquiri that was wonderful. The breakfast area was nice, however more variety is needed. The walk on the beach was very nice, and I may have to have friends to invite. I had a room with a kitchenette when traveling on a budget it helps big time. I will love to stay again, as time permits. I was told by the front desk that they are working on the internet, it may be wise to set up a data portale until you are able to have the WiFi working correctly. Also a restaurant would be a nice attraction. Local calls are charged to your room so cellphone is best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: cassie-a-roo
Reviews.Content: Came down to Florida for a week vacation. First problem I had is they gave me instructions over the phone...(OBVIOUSLY I'm on vacation) I don't know where I'm going. Ok we can help you...You will see 7 eleven, i hop...well there is about 5 IHOPs and 30 7 elevens. Oh well. Rooms were very comfy, front desk was decent, Breakfast was ok..could use more variety. The best part was THE VIEW!! Breath taking sunrise!Even though I didn't get the room I requested. RIght on the beach. Pool was very refreshing and very clean.Oh and I see from every one Hot tubs never open...Well they decided to paint them over spring break...duh.. it was hot out anyway. OH and internet was HORRIBLE...It gave my computer the blue screen of death. And I have GREAT protection on my laptop. It was fine at next hotel we stayed...

Reviews.Title: “There are other places to stay”
Reviews.Author: cmoody1962
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Acapulco for a Spring Break vacation. I found a lot of truth to previous reviews that I'd read. The rooms were clean, though nothing spectacular. The housekeeping staff was friendly, but the front desk personnel were apathetic. The continental breakfast was so-so. There is a small bar that opened late in the afternoon, but there was no entertainment or restaurant. The pool area is a mess. There is an old tiki bar that doesn't appear to have been used for some time. The staff told us that the pool heater was broken, so really it was too cold to swim in. There are two hot tubs. One appears to have been inoperable for quite some time and is covered with a weathered piece of plywood. When we arrived on Sunday, the water in the other hottub was yellow. Yes, yellow. Finally, on Tuesday, someone cleaned the hottub and the water was clear again. On Wednesday, they were doing some sort of repair to the heater on that hottub, but by Wednesday evening, it was clear that they hadn't adjusted the thermostat correctly. It was too hot to use. the concrete around the pool area is dirty--really dirty. The furniture around the pool area is just as dirty. It needs the kind of cleaning that you can only get with acid, a stiff brush, a shovel, and elbow grease. This place could be a lot better than what it is if someone really cared about the property. I'm really kind of surprised the health department isn't involved in this issue. Yes, it was just that dirty. This was my second trip to Daytona Beach. Prior to this trip, I stayed in a condo. While on this trip, I scoped out the other hotels in the area. There are plenty of places to stay on Daytona Beach. Don't choose this place.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT!!!! WE LOVED IT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DebbieS64
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Daytona, This was the best place we have stayed so far. We have NOT ONE complaint about our stay at this motel. I truly say if you are going there stay here! The pool, the beach, staff, everything AWESOME!! There is a great little resturant across the street for a late breakfast or early lunch, he's been 30 yrs,also another place down So Atlantic is Porto Finos.. Oh ya the only complaint was the bartender Diana not real friendly but the other one Nicki was great!!! Just give the place a shot. I was worried because of the other reviews, but very happy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Got what we payed for”
Reviews.Author: SonjaB4
Reviews.Content: Left this hotel today after staying for 3 days. Website pictures ARE NOT ACCURATE! those pictures look like they were taken the day the hotel was built, or someone retouched the photos! The pool and the one hot tub that worked are not very clean. Everything outside looks neglected, but the inside is kept up well. They do not have a resaurant. The photos you see are for you to sit and eat your breakfast. The breakfast is continental, so that is what you get. But the man serving was so friendly and polite. But getting to the biggest disappointment was today when we were still enjoying ourself. That was rudely interrrupted. the night before in the lobby they advertised that you could pay extra to make the checkout time later. So i told the girl at the front desk that i would like to extend our checkout time to 3:00 pm. And i had the money in my hand. She said that would be fine, and that I could pay that when we check out. Well the next morning while I was on the beach with my kids, my husband called me from the room. He said we had to check out immediately. i went to the front desk and told them the same thing about cheking out late. they said that is only based on availablility. Anyways, because the girl the night before made a mistake, we had to stop what we were doing and pack up. The head housekeeper came to our room to let us know we could takae our time, and that there were 4 other families that the same thing happened to! The front desk just blamed the NEW girl from the night before and gave us until 1:00 to check out. I was mostly dissappointed because other than that, I would have come back again. But the staff at the desk were as rude as they could be about the whole issue. And the "great and powerful oz" making the decisions never came out from behind the walls to face customers. But most of all the girl that confronted me at the front desk was the rudest, she wasnt even the person helping me in the first place.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: MudderDeb
Reviews.Content: The lady at the front desk made our day! After an awful start to our vacation (we had to change motels) we were so upset and stressed at having to move hotels at the last min. Upon our arrival at the Acapulco, they had not yet recieved our Expedia reservations but the young lady at the desk went ahead and gave us a room with the promise to follow up with Expedia later so we could start our vacation. She was great!!! We had an oceanfront kitchenette with 2 double beds on a corner, more than a great view. The beds were VERY comfortable but the a/c cycles way too often and is too loud, interfering with a good nights sleep. The kitchenette was convenient but rarely used. The continental breakfast was excellent! Pool is big, clean, 2 hot tubs were subpar, one not working at all and one barely warm and/or not bubbling. Only real complaint about hotel is that there are only 2 elevators and BOTH are extremely slow and small. Other than that though, it's a very clean, well priced hotel on the sourthern end of Daytona Beach where it's much more family friendly. Since I live fairly close, I go to the beach often and this will now be my "go to" hotel from now on!

Reviews.Title: “May Be Older But It's a Gem!”
Reviews.Author: JFlow08
Reviews.Content: As always, I was apprehensive booking this hotel after reading some of the reviews on here but I am glad I went with my heart and took a chance with the Acapulco! Yes, it is not the newest hotel on the strip (not by a long shot) but you can tell they renovated it not too long ago and it is holding up nicely. We opted for the oceanfront room and the view alone paid for itself. Our room was huge and the mini kitchenette wasn't all old and nasty looking like some of the other hotel's are like. We would have definitely used it if we were staying longer. The beds, although doubles, were comfy and the carpets and such weren't all dingy and spotted. Expectations met and surpassed. Also, I don't know how they motivate their staff but everyone, and I do mean EVERYONE, we encountered, whether it was in the elevator or passing in the hallway, always spoke and was oh so friendly. It was almost strange to run into so much niceness (say a lot about society nowadays, I guess). At any rate, I do love Daytona and with this stay the Acapulco has vaulted to the top of my list of destinations when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “An average good value hotel”
Reviews.Author: 666ryd
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during bike week, virgin package holiday from the uk. We found all the staff friendly & the place was clean & tidy, Morgan on the front desk especially helpful. Was a little run down but no more so than most of the similar hotels. The distance to main street & the breakfast were the two worst things about the hotel, but the bus stops outside & mikes diner is over the road. Next time I would stay more central, but no real complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice for the money!”
Reviews.Author: HSmith_131
Reviews.Content: I'm really glad that I didn't pay any attention to the bad reviews. This place was very clean, great location, awesome view of the beach/ocean and a super friendly staff. The front desk attendents were very pleasant when assisting us. The house keeping staff was so cheerful and polite, and did an excellent job. They really seemed to enjoy taking care of the guests. Our room was very clean and the bathroom had plenty of clean towels and wash cloths. It was nice to have a room that didn't smell musky or smokey. The breakfast staff and food was also very good. Always clean and plentiful. Being non smokers, it was nice to enjoy a beverage in the smoke free bar. We didn't have a maintenence problem, but did meet the maintenence person. The only issure we had was the wifi not working correctly and that was in the process of being repaired. We really enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “We were happy!”
Reviews.Author: hdwekirk
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews of this hotel, I wanted to add my opinion, since we enjoyed our one-night stay there on Jan. 29 very much. The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, our room was average (but beds were comfortable), our 7th-floor balcony offered a lovely view of both the ocean and the river, and I didn't mind paying the small parking and in-room safe fee. The continental breakfast was limited, but very fresh and we were satisfied with it. The best part of our stay was the beautiful beach and the great location of our hotel, near the Daytona Beach boardwalk, shops and restaurants. You can walk out the back door of the hotel onto a perfect beach for long walks. It's very flat with packed-down sand for walking and bike riding. Would we stay here again? Maybe. I usually prefer a little more luxury in my hotel, but this was quite nice for the very affordable price. Don't be scared by the bad reviews. We didn't worry about our balcony door lock being wobbly, because we were on the 7th floor! But we were a little disappointed there was no bar or restaurant on-site. I hope to get back to Daytona Beach again soon.

Reviews.Title: “NOT A 3 STAR NO WAY”
Reviews.Author: bigdaddy14301
Reviews.Content: outside appearence was good,but dining area was filthy carpets dirty,uphlstery was dirty,pool area was terrible chairs dirty,pool bad shape,hot tubs were inop.no way this is a 3 star resort maybe a 1 star do not stay

Reviews.Title: “Real Nice Placeon the Beach”
Reviews.Author: miamiamii
Reviews.Content: Can't imagine what others saw,but the place was clean, nice bedding, and very nice staff. I made comments to a few of the crew about how clean everything was and much nicer than the reviews make it sound. Would have liked to have enjoyed the hot tub, but it was still a very nice New Year's Eve getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there! Tired, run down, dirty linen.”
Reviews.Author: BJT1959
Reviews.Content: We were going to book this hotel within our Virgin holiday to Orlando, but decided not to & that we would just go for a couple of days when it suited us. What a mistake! pre book before you go as by doing it when we got there cost an extra $70. Reception area is about the only up to date area. Our room 219 looked tired & dated but we don't expect perfection. First they had to come sort the safe out, then bring a remote for the TV. Took the Grand Children down to the beach was great, nice & clean, but the kids wanted to go in the pool, that receptionist told us was heated. NO is was not, the kids could not get in it was so cold. Then noticed the jacuzzi area out of use but what a disgrace it was absolutely filthy. My husband was in the meantime trying to get the free wifi sorted but it would not work no matter what you did & we needed this to keep in touch with the kids parents back in UK. Went out for something to eat, came back to put grand children to bed pulled covers back to find crumpled, stained sheets, tried the other bed & this was the same. Called reception to be told no-one available in house-keeping to change the sheets, but we could come & collect some sheets. & change them ourselves or could have a room upgrade. We took the room upgrade but went to inspect the room first. Guess what, yet more stained sheets & these also had black marks on them. Furious, so called & requested a refund & was told no management on site & would try to contact manager. As we had to wait collected sheets so could at least put kids to bed in original room that weren't even ironed. At this time other people were in reception about the wifi. Went on balcony & room overlooked the rubbish skips, the lock on balcony was hanging out the wall, wardrobe door swinging on it's hinges, the room door did not look secure when closed, that's when we took in how run down the room/hotel was. It took 3hours to get hold of manager who did agree to a refund so we legged it out of there back to our main hotel back in Orlando, International Drive to a clean room with crisp, clean sheets.

Reviews.Title: “Bloody thief”
Reviews.Author: drds14
Reviews.Content: The hotel was neat and clean. But, we did not get the room ready when we arrived. Secondly, when we checked out, they charged me fee for safe which I did not even touch, used or even asked for. Also, they charged from my card roughly 25 dollars extra. On asking they said that the previously they charged me a cheaper rate. Now the rate was reviewed. Luckily, I had a hard copy of the booking which I showed them. They were bound to refund me the extra charge (still waiting for the money). Be aware!!!!

Reviews.Title: “RUDE front desk Staff, Horrible Room, RUINED Honeymoon! Don't Go!!”
Reviews.Author: PeaceLoveLizards
Reviews.Content: Booked our room a month in advance and called to make sure our room would be on the Top floor with a King Bed for our Honeymoon. Was told the room would be held under "NO Change" so everything was all set. I called again Two days before our wedding just to double check, told everything was as we requested. When we checked in we were told ONLY the 1st & 2nd floors were available. When I told them I had called two days earlier they said the best they could offer was the 6th floor, then ended up with two small beds! They also told us the Electricity would be Off the next day from 1-5, Ugh!! the front desk staff rudely offered to waive the parking fee and we set out to make the best of it. The breakfast was ok, but the breakfast staff was wonderful. Nice pool and view, Great outside Staff!! At Check out they tried to charge us the parking fee and when I said it was supposed to be waived the Front desk girl got angry and rudely shoved the paperwork in my hand without saying a word. Worst Hotel Experience-EVER!!! Will NEVER Return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_and_JF
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Acapulco for almost 15 years now. We stay for 3-4 weeks. We have met many wonderful people there. This time I would like to commend Keith in the morning at the Continental Breakfast. He goes out of his way to help you with any of your needs. He brought us towels everyday for the pool. I would also like to mention Charlie the maintenance man. He was out there everyday cleaning the pool and pool deck. This was the first time I really saw someone there working very hard. He kept the pool area very clean. The rooms were always clean and the front desk people are always very friendly. This is one of the nicer hotels in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Meh”
Reviews.Author: tbarnhart339
Reviews.Content: We wanted to have a last little vacation before the birth of our daughter, so we decided to stay a few nights at Daytona. We called Acapulco's parent company to book reservations at a sister hotel, there was a radio gig going on there so they were nice enough to tell us that if we wanted peace and quite that was not the place to be and reccomended Acapulco, touting it as being newly refurbished. The agent went ahead and book the ocean view kings suite for us, it had a kitchen and everything. She also booked us for late check out when we were to leave. The hotel did look like it was newly refurbished on the outside, but when we got to out room, it was not. The smell in the room was of wet dog, the carpet was wet from where it was cleaned (not just damp, but wet), it didn't have a view of the ocean, and to top it all off we were supplied with coffee fixings, all except a coffee maker. Being pregnant at the time, I had a difficult time getting comfortable and there was only one pillow supplied to the room, so my husband called down to see if we could get an extra pillow ot two, the desk's response was that they were not sure if they had any extras, but they were going to check and call us back. We never recieved a call back. We had requested late checkout, because we didn't want to be rushed. Our last day came and at 8 in the morning, there is a knock at the door, it was house keeping wanting to get in there. Our check out time was for 1. We told the house keeper this and she said "ok". About an hour later, there is another knock at the door from another house keeper, we did the same thing. By about 11, there was a third knock at the door from a third house keeper, wanting us to get out, when we sent her away, our phone rings and it is the desk asking us why we weren't out. We told her that we have late check out. She said she saw that on our reservations, but that they needed the room. Needless to say, our final vacation before our daughter was born was anything but relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Way better than we expected! We'll be back.”
Reviews.Author: krimicri
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about what we'd be getting after reading some of these reviews, but I was worried for nothing. We were very pleasantly surprised when we arrived, it was much nicer than we thought it would be. The rooms were clean, had a fridge, microwave and coffee pot, hair dryer in the bathroom, and in an ocean view room we had a great view of the ocean. The hot tubs were out of service, but that didn't bother me, the pool was more than good enough for me, and it was very clean. The breakfast bar has many items to choose from and the attendant is really nice and helpful. We had a great time and definitely recommend this place!

Reviews.Title: “Got this hotel from travelocity with the...”
Reviews.Author: BrittKenJam
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel from travelocity with the top secret hotel thing for $46 for the night. It was right on the beach. The lobby was nice. The rooms were not as nice. The carpets seemed dirty and there were several large stains on them. There was also a large rust stain in the shower. The lady informed us at check in that the pool will be closed all week. But for the price I would say it was a bargain because of the location. Would not stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Acapulco”
Reviews.Author: hueytaxi
Reviews.Content: 4th time staying over four years as we follow our minor league baseball team. We had issues this trip on the 3rd floor oceanfront. Noise from the pool deck on Friday night and in the halls until about 2:30 AM. Our friends on the street side on the 2nd floor complained aboud street noise. We also had the top of the palms blocking some of our view of thew ocean and pool Still in the past we have been on the 8th fllor and been isolated from those issues. Get to know the housekeeping staff. Michelle is a wonderful lady who catered to every need. Her Super also noted we need to always aks for an oceanfront room ending in 05 to receive the largest room. Oceanfront had large apartment refrigerators while interior rooms have full size. I ce is located on about 4 floors as are the other ameniies. There is a laundry on the 3rd floor. Continental breakfast and free wi-fi. I think this is the first year charging for parking and the safe. A friend riding with us had both removed from her bill since she did not use either. We will be back as long as the team stays there.

Reviews.Title: “Very hard to give a staight review”
Reviews.Author: gamiller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is all over the place. The decor was fairly pleasing. There were many families there and did appear to be kid friendly. The price was reasonable but please lose the parking fee.. both nights there I was awakened to loud booms in the middle of the night, once was fireworks and the last night sounded like gunfire. The room decor will eye appealing had serious deficits. The chain on the door for added security was missing. The sliding door to the balcony was almost impossible ( I weigh 215lbs) to open The 2 hot tubs were not working. The employees while friendly were not as polished as at other hotels. If your on a budget this place might suffice ,but there are much better places available.

Reviews.Title: “Older hotel, good for the price”
Reviews.Author: tw101
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been remodled and updated. The rooms are nice with stainless steel appliances in the kitchenette. The rooms were clean but the pool deck, beach front, and grounds needed attention. If the hotel would just hire a part time emplyee to keep trash picked up and pool area clean it would be much better.

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but it depends how much you paid!!!”
Reviews.Author: clevasseur
Reviews.Content: My family and I (2 adults and 2 kids) stayed at the Acapulco for 2 weeks in July (21 to Aug. 4) of this year. I was scared by some of the reviews but I was pleasantly surprised. First thing I got to say about the Acapulco is this : the location is simply incredible… We had an oceanfront efficiency room with a kitchenette. The view was splendid and the room was… well… efficient! The cook top and the fridge allow you to cut back on restaurant spending and invest your money on theme parks and other stuff kids like! We made dinner in our room mostly of the time. The balcony was also useful for me and my wife during the childrens napping time! A bottle of wine, some crakers and cheese, all of that ocenfront... That's was cool! The room was ok. Like I said in the title, it depends on how much you paid. I paid 77$ per night so, it was a good deal. But I would never, ever pay the 150$ per night they were charging at the front desk for a night… And if I did so, I would’ve feel like I’ve been robbed! The room was ok. Not too big but ok. The W/C was a little bit small but we didn’t care much. The carpet looks old but it looks clean. The beds were fine and the A/C was a bit noisy but it makes me fall asleep so… Housekeeping was made daily, the maids were very cool and they did a good job. Not a great one but a good one. To there discharges, on several days, I saw only 1 maid on my floor. So, how can she do a spotless job in 21 rooms in 7 hours? That’s impossible! Maybe the hotels should consider hiring more maids!!! That being said, the room was clean every day and that’s what matter! The hotel staff at the front desk was polite and efficient. I got a 1 or 2 little problems in my room and each time the problem was solved in a matter of minutes. The continental breakfast was good! The man who was taking care of it was cool and very nice! Always asking if we needed something. The breakfast includes bagel, English muffins, Danishes of all kinds, oatmeal… The pool was nice! Very useful after a day at the beach! The pool and the chairs were cleaned every morning. The bar at the pool was opened on mostly days and it was selling drinks and beer. The whirlpool was not working (either one of them) but honestly, at 110F, who cares!!! The hotel itself, except for the main hall, could use a refresh. The carpet in the hallways looks old and the wall could use a painting jobs. But, like my wife said to me: It’s a beach hotel so! The Wi-Fi is simply not working. I’m not a geek but I know how to setup up a computer and I’ve tried several options but it was not working. That pissed us off because we had to go to the library or at McDonald to get a WIFI and get an Internet access. I asked but nothing changed. The elevator a very slow and you’ve got to be a very patient person. To the people who said there was no parking… I don’t know when you got there but the hotel was full and there were plenty of parking spaces left! Speaking of parking, there are a 5$ per day fees… Which is not that high considering that the parking at the Hilton will cost you 20$ and park your car in one of the lot beachfront will cost you at least 8$. There are severals Ice machine but, we were on 5th floor and our didn’t work so I had to go on the 6th to get my ice. The washing and drying machine are fine. 2.25$ is not the cheapest I've seen but they did what they were supposed to do! For the city, I felt in love with Daytona Beach… It’s a great city, everything is near or about (1h to Seaworld and Disney) and, you have to take a walk to the Beach Center area. It’s crowded, there are good restaurants, everybody looks happy and the beaches, from Daytona Beach to Daytona Beach Shores, they are just incredible! It's a clean white sanded beach. You got to see it! To resume my self: at 77$ per night, just for the location, it was a deal. With a kitchenette, it was better. With the city, it was great! The hotel in itself is good and I think we would go back to the Acapulco in vacations. We recommend it but at a fair price… Not at 150$ per night… Last thing. If you want to eat pizza, try the cheese pizza from King Louis. It is the BEST pizza I’ve tasted in my life!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the price.”
Reviews.Author: cardinal50
Reviews.Content: My family styed here for 5 days and had a great time . Staff was friendly, especially the gentleman and lady at the continental breakfast. Rooms were clean and pool towels were supplied by the resort. Hot tubs were not working but it was so hot, who cares. Had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Much better than we had expected!”
Reviews.Author: emnickalex
Reviews.Content: Travelled from OH to FL with our 3 kids (age 6). Got a great deal on this hotel booking online before we left as a "mystery hotel" through Bookit. Stayed 5 nights. Our room is very nice. Has 2 double beds, a small round table with 2 chairs, a kitchenette which includes fridge, microwave, 2 burner stove, coffe make, small sink. Made dinner 1 night in room with no problem. Kitchen is stocked with the basics, 3 or 4 pots/pans, some dishes/plates, cups, silverware, utensils, cutting boards, can opener, collander, mixing bowls & mixing spoons, toaster, etc. Our room is clean, nicely decorated and updated. I do not think that it looks old or dirty at all. We have an in-room safe that we have not needed. The cost for it is $1.50 per day. The parking is $5 per night. I feel that is not at all a bad price (have you ever paid for parking in a large city such as NYC, Cleveland, Toronto, etc?! -YIKES!!!). The parking lots are rather small though (1 on either side of the hotel) so that when you back out your car you have to be careful not to hit the car parked opposite of you. Our room is a side oceanview room. We have a small balcony with a small round table and 2 chairs. Too hot to actually sit out there but I do put the towels and swimsuits out there to dry. The A/C in our room works very well and in fact cools down the room very well to the point that sometimes I get too cold at night. The pillows are big and fluffy and there are about 4 per bed. Soft warm extra blankets are provided as well. There is a guest laundry room on the 3rd floor which has 2 washers and 2 dryers. I used it at 6am on a weekday morning and it was empty, didn't get busy until around 8am. The cost is $2.25 per machine which I thought was high (paid only $1.25 at our hotel on the Gulf side last wk). But there is a machine in the laundry room which sells soap and fabric softener for only $1 each. Also a large counter on which to sort or fold clothes. The front desk staff (only have seen 1 working at a time) are always very friendly and helpful and had no problem when I repeatedly kept asking them for more change (quarters for the washers). There is free WiFi in the rooms which I have been using all week with no problems. Takes a few tries to get connected but after connection, no problems. There is also a computer with printer in the lobby but it costs at least $3 to use it. I would bring your own laptop if possible. The continental breakfast is "ok". The man who primarily works it is SUPER nice. He made my kids hot chocolate with whipped cream a few mornings and is very helpful to clear your place, get you more drinks, etc. The breakfast is free and includes canned tropical fruit, oatmeal, cottage cheese, english muffins, mini muffins, bread/toast, bagels, cream cheese, butter, jelly, apple juice, OJ, cofree, tea, dry cereal. I have to say that the coffee is quite good as is the OJ. You serve yourself and toast your bagels etc in 2 toasters. There are 2 (maybe 3?) seating areas which are clean and comfortable. There is a sign that says you may not take any of the food beyond those seating areas but in talking to the nice man who works it, he said that is just the management's "insurance policy" in case they need to enforce it. He let me take food to the laundry room (I don't like to leave my laundry alone LOL) as well as up to the room. Other than the free breakfast, the hotel does NOT have a restaurant which I found disappointing. The front desk said they used to have one but it closed a few yrs ago. There is an ATM in the hotel lobby which charges $2.75 when you take money out. The lobby is actually quite nice. Large, clean, well furnished, lots of places to sit. There are 2 elevators to take you upstairs (8 floors). Our room is on the 7th floor. The elevators are VERY slow and it is quicker (but hotter) to take 1 of the 2 stairways instead. Also of note, there is NOT an ice machine on each floor. We had to go down 1 or 2 floors to find an ice machine. The housekeeping staff are VERY nice and do a good job cleaning the room each day. Also anytime I have needed anything (extra towels, forks, dish soap) and have called the front desk for it, someone has brought it up to me right away. The location is good because it is right on the beach although you really have to drive to any of the restaurants, attractions, etc because it is too hot to walk that far. There is a mini golf place directly across the street though we read poor reviews about it and decided to try the one a bit further down the street. The beach is very nice and clean and is accessed from steps down off the pool deck. We have had no problems with the pool area. The pool is very large and I believe goes in depth from 3 ft to about 8 or 9 ft. The pool water is much too hot but I don't think that is the hotel's fault, I think the water is just hot due to the hot sun. There are lots of beach chairs available. There is also a small kiddie pool that my kids have been in a few times but it is full of sand and I wish they would clean it out. There are 2 hot tubs which are empty of water and are not in use- they look old and dirty, however I do not miss those though as honestly it is too hot to be sitting in a hot tub, even at night! The pool is open til about 10 or 11pm which is nice. There is a tiny "tiki" bar on the pool deck which has only been opened a few times during our stay. It is more like a tiki cart though and kind of cheesy looking. I wanted to charge a drink to my room but the bartender told me it was "cash only" and I don't take cash down to the pool. There are a few areas of tables and chairs out the back door of the hotel on the way to the pool. One night we had pizza delivered and sat out there for dinner with our 3 kids. It was nice and a cheap easy dinner. Overall I would recommend this hotel. It is not the Hilton but it is not a roach motel either! It looks very nice both outside and inside and honestly looks better than many of the hotels I have seen on this street.

Reviews.Title: “RUN, RUN, RUN as fast as you can!”
Reviews.Author: 47BaseballMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and I decided to take a quick trip to Daytona for the weekend. When I got the rate on Priceline I thought I had gotten a GREAT deal based on other reviews and that it was rated as a 3 star hotel. Had I paid full price for this hotel I would have been at the office of the BBB prior to leaving Daytona. Obviously as one other reviewer noted management DOES NOT CARE! When I checked in there was a maintenance guy at the front desk who said "she'll be back". Ten minutes later he tried to radio the check in clerk to find that her radio was sitting next to him. Approximately 5 minutes after that she gets off the elevator, sees me at the desk and takes her time to come and check me. Did not welcome me, tell me where to park or ANYTHING! Did not tell me ANYTHING about a deposit either! I asked her what type of room I had she said "you have 2 beds". I said may I change to "1 King". She says "NOPE". Needless to say I left alone as I was looking forward to a GREAT weekend away not a weekend of being in a HELL WHOLE. My husband and I proceeded to our room to find a stained floor as soon as opening the door to our room. Proceeded to look at the beds which appeared clean but made up very messy. I then proceeded to the bathroom where sand was all over the floor. Tried to go to sleep to hear the ice machine outside our door constantly going off, kids with their parents running the halls and yelling well past midnight. The next morning got a shower to see that the shower fixtures were old and rusted. Went into the kitchen area, just to check it out, to find rust all over the side of the refrigerator and something all over the 2 burner stove. Stopped to eat the advertised "free breakfast" to find it looked horrible. Saw that the "restaurant" is the extent of the free continental breakfast. The bar was never open. Proceeded down to the pool to find it dirty and uninviting so we went straight to the beach where it was WONDERFUL! That night was the same routine with people beating on doors, hollering down the halls, etc. Called the front desk and was told we can't do anything about that. Checked out the next morning to find that the Acapulco Inn had charged my card for Pricelines fee that I HAD ALREADY PAID as well as their deposit. The same person who checked me in checked me out and told me that I would have to call the manager back the next day that there was nothing she could do. She proceeded to tell me that I better call at 8am as he is on a conference call at 10am and leaves immediately after the conference call. Hello, this is the manager's schedule!!!! Have yet to be able to speak with him. Bottom line, people are RUDE, hotel is a RIP OFF! DO NOT STAY HEAR. Will never return to the Acapulco Inn

Reviews.Title: “This place does not look like it does in the pictures!”
Reviews.Author: SharonK64
Reviews.Content: We had 3 nights booked and left after one and went to the Hilton Oceanwalk. It was only $20 more nightly and was so much nicer and cleaner. We had just left Disney and my main objective when booking this place was finding someplace clean with a pool and nice beach. It had a beach but it was not the hotel was not the cleanest and the pool area was not clean. Chairs had mold on them and the people--not sure what to say. I am never one to put myself above anyone else but it was not someplace to have a young child.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Poor Service!!!”
Reviews.Author: akinaz99
Reviews.Content: From the time we checked in to the time we checked out there were problems! Our room had a bathroom door that had been kicked in & couldn't be shut all the way or locked for privacy. The closet was impossible to use because the doors kept falling off. The lights kept shutting off on the entire floor. The elevator rode very rough like it was desperately needing service & we were on the 8th floor. When poolside the so called cabana bar was open a total of two hours our entire 4 day stay. The indoor bar would close when ever they felt like it. We actually had a bartenders boyfriend blurt out that she was already closing up when we walked in before 10pm. She didn't say anything. The two jacuzzis were inoperable. One was 1/2 full & the other was 1/2 full & green!!! The manager Jeff Hamilton was completely unaccountablr for anything going on there when he was there. Keith handling the eating area in the morning was quite helpful as well as our housekeeper. Other than that this place had two things going for it -location & location! $200 bucks a night, what a joke.then they wanted to charge hidden nightly parking fees! Sp[oke to many people by the pool that swaid they really used to enjoy this place but they'd never come again. What a shame! I guess they'll just keep preying on new guests till they run out .............

Reviews.Title: “Pass on this place”
Reviews.Author: Momto4inWI
Reviews.Content: 1) I have never experienced a slower elevator than theirs! It was downright horribly slow, and every time we took it (we were on the 8th floor), everyone waiting with us complained also. 2) Horribly stiff bedding and awful pillows. 3) Our refridgerator froze our food and it was on low! 4) Free continental breakfast... only they put out a sign that you have to eat it in the dining area and cannot bring it to guest rooms. 5) Whirlpool was DISGUSTING! One looked like it may have been working, but after seeing the other one there was no way I'd go in. It had a little water on the bottom that looked green and really dirty. 6) Bohemian bar/grill was never opened during the entire weekend!! 7) The staff walked around all day every day ranting about issues... take them behind closed doors please. 8) Don't bring a big vehicle to this hotel because you'll never get in and out of the parking lot... it's so tight! 9) Apparently you'll be charged for a locked safe box, even if you don't put money into it and use it. Won't be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “You Really Do Get What you Pay For”
Reviews.Author: Helicity30
Reviews.Content: I would have to agree with most of the reviews on here. You do get what you pay for and there is a reason this place is cheap! After only 24 hours, here are some issues right off the bat. 1) An entire baseball team was checking in, along with dozens of other people, and only one person was working the front desk. 2) The pool... gross! Pool deck is not taken care of and not cleaned (in years most likely). Pool chairs are dirty. A pool light fixture was hanging out of the pool with a wire. Hot tubs were not working and mostly drained. The supposed Tiki bar looks like a roll away cart, and was never opened during our trip. Apparently they don't use it at all anymore? 3) Stayed in oceanfront efficiency room and was cooking dinner, Most of the silverwear was missing and had to wait near 2 hours to get a fork delivered. I would have been happy to go down and get a fork from whatever staff they had, but they insisted someone had to deliver that (along with a can opener). 4) Despite there not being smoking allowed, most of the hallways smell like smoke and the carpets are pretty dirty. 5) It does appear the hotel tried to do some sort of renovation back in like 2006 or something, but you can't really tell except the lobby is fairly nice. Also the counters have been replaced with a foux-granite. 6) High speed internet connection is sporadic at best. If you can get online and connected, speed is pretty good... otherwise, good luck! 7) If you are going to the beach just for the beach, then you may be okay here. Oceanfront units have great view (just stay 3rd floor or higher, as 1st and 2nd floors-views are blocked by palm trees). 8) The bathroom fan started quiet, but after being on for about a minute, sounded like a jet about to take off. Sounds picky I know.. but it was really weird/crazy! Bottom-line. There are plenty of hotels that are cleaner and care more about their customers for similar or slightly higher costs. My advice is spend a few extra bucks, and you'll enjoy your trip a lot more.

Reviews.Title: “We were not given the room we reserved beacuse they overbooked...”
Reviews.Author: upstatenyfan
Reviews.Content: We reserved and paid for an oceanfront room and upon check-in found ourselves in a side oceanview room. There was no manager on site on a Saturday to help out and the gentleman at the front desk said he saw our reservation and that the manager of the hotel took it upon himself to downgrade our reservation because they overbooked the hotel. WHAT?? He also said maybe he could move us on Monday. Unacceptable. He told us to meet with Valerie, the manager, Sunday morning at 7 am to see if she could explain why this was done. We spent the first night in the sideview room with an adjoining door in the kitchen through which we heard every word from the neighboring room as well as their screeching child! We reserved an oceanfront room because they do not adjoin and thus preventing the noise from neighbors. The next morning at 8 am Valerie did change our room that afternoon. She still never explained why the management took it upon themselves to do this. Others behind us at the desk received the same treatment. So, double check and confirm your room before you go! The beach is nice, the pool is crowded and completely unsupervised. There was some behavior that would not be considered appropriate for children. The one hot tub is empty and broken and the other was dirty and basically unusable. The oceanfront room was small but very nice. The small kitchenette was a blessing. Bathroom fan and room air conditioner are both quite noisy but ear plugs help. Housekeeping was friendly and came to clean our room between 1 and 2 every day. The continental breakfast featured fresh fruit, fruit cocktail, muffins, pastry, toast, English muffins, and plain bagels. There are also orange juice, coffee, and tea available. The area was kept clean and the tables were comfortable. Overall, this is a comfortable beach hotel at a wonderfully affordable price. If they can work out the small glitches I would return in a heartbeat! If you go to Daytona Beach you MUST visit Via Genovese on Dunlawton Ave just off South Atlantic Avenue. What a great find for authentic NY pizza and Italian dishes. The owners are from NYC and you can bet this is great food!

Reviews.Title: “Not horibble...but definitely not great.”
Reviews.Author: caito34
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Memorial Day weekend...great location, right on the beach. That's the only thing I would describe great with this hotel. You can tell it's an older hotel...the decor is nice but used looking. The lobby is nice and the grounds are nice but the pool area was dirty, the tiki bar was a cart basically with old, dirty chairs and the hot tubs didn't work. Note to manager...for an upcoming holiday weekend, get the hot tubs fixed. One had water in it but the jets didn't work and the other was empty...both looked old. They do charge for parking and you better not go out at night because you won't have a space when you get back...it was probably like this because it was full for the holiday. Our rooms were okay...we had an oceanfront efficiency. The beds are only doubles and quite small so if your large and sleep with another, you'll be up most of the night...no room. Our view was very nice but the beach was blocked by palm trees, no big deal...good view of the pool area though with beach in background. The free high speed internet was unreliable but when it did work, it was good speed wise. Try to get a lower floor, thank God we did...because in this hotel the staff has the right of way. They do not have service elevators so the wait for the elevators was frustrating...mainly due to staff and housekeepers going up and down. We were on the 2nd floor and only used them when we had the cooler for the beach so we didn't suffer too much. The breakfast is decent...nothing special, a quick bite. Little muffins, bagels, english muffins, cereal, fruit cocktail, juice, coffee, etc. - nothing hot, except oatmeal in packets you have to make with hot water. Would we return? No...only because Florida has so many other places to offer...especially Daytona. My biggest gripe would have to be the beds, the hottubs not working (just showing they don't care) and the state of the place...not dirty but just used looking. For the price, you can find better.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor service. Certainly not on my list of hotels to revisit!”
Reviews.Author: crjlkld
Reviews.Content: I booked this stay through priceline.com. Beware, the 3:00 p.m. check-in time is also shift change. I learned upon check-out that I had to pay extra for parking on hotel property. This was a first for me and was not mentioned at check-in, just at check-out. It was pointed out that I had initialed the registration form indicating the parking fee. Okay, you got me. WARNING: Read then sign! Not sure if this fee is for all guests or just those who negotiate rates through sites like priceline.com. Parking fees at hotels are not usual and customary charges in my humble opinion. As such, it is a fee that should be prominently displayed and/or certainly vocalized to all guests at the time of registration. The lobby computer requires the use of a credit card so bring your laptop computer for free Wi-Fi or pay the high rates per minute in the lobby. Room was adequate but had well worn carpet. Bathroom exhaust fan was quite noisy. A/C unit was also noisy making restful sleep difficult. Traffic noise was very noticeable on the upper floors where I was located. Restaurant was not open. No fitness center here but available up the road at a sister facility for no charge. A little inconvenient but free none the less. I’m not sure if parking is free when visiting the fitness center at the sister facility. In hindsight, I should have just stayed at the sister facility. East elevator was a bit shaky and bouncy. So use it if you like a little thrill ride. West elevator was fine. Used east and west stairwells several times and found them to need a thorough cleaning. Not a very friendly atmosphere here. The only friendly staff I encountered was the young lady attending the breakfast bar area. Attitude is everything and their attitude toward friendly service was poor. With businesses pleading for customers just to survive in this very poor economy, that's a pretty sad statement! There is much more bang for the buck available out there and I can't in good conscience recommend this hotel to a friend. A walk on the beach and watching a beautiful sunrise saved this from being a total waste of time and money.

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING!!”
Reviews.Author: pdo1965
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our teenage son vacationed to Daytona Beach and stayed at this hotel. check in was supposed to be April 30th to May 10th we booked through allegiant air.(big mistake). So many things went wrong in this hotel. 1st off check was horrible the front desk staff is extremally rude. They charge you for parking everyday . We paid extra to have a oceanfront room and our room was over a garabge dumpster so i went down stairs and complained and told the lady we paid for a upgrade to ocean front and she said it will be an additional $30.00 per night. we paid again. then our room had a musty smell, the remote to the tv was not worling and never did get fixed. the dryer in the hotel does not work. we woke up with red bite marks on our skin. the tiki bar is like the size of your smallest bathrooom. and nobody is ever working in it. we complained about so many issues and nothing was done. so we checked out on wednesday three days later and they wouldnt give us a refund or credit for the 4 days we did not stay. the manager never called us back even though we left several messages for him to contact us. worst hotel i have ever stayed in dont be fooled by the pictures. pat, Bondurant, Ia

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: KindredSpirit07
Reviews.Content: Good location. Quiet. Clean room. Recent remodel. Nice lobby. Quick check-in/out. Decent standard breakfast. Nice pool (warm!). Comfy beds. Nice kitchenette. Oceanview (on the north side of the hotel) was just as good as oceanfront in my opinion becasue of the angle of the building and nothing tall next door. Some oceanview rooms at other hotels mean you have to go out on the balcony and turn your head to see water. This was a nice wide ocean view from the room. On the negative side: (nothing major) Wi-fi was poor. Pool-guy took his sweet time smoking cigs and cleaning the pool so it finally opened over an hour after the posted time. I drank the most awful cup of coffee imaginable at the free breakfast. I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A trip to remember”
Reviews.Author: U4reaFood
Reviews.Content: The weather was fantastic, and the service at the resort was amazing. The tiki bar was a hot spot, and we enjoyed ourselves very much.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Resort”
Reviews.Author: brenrobe
Reviews.Content: Very far from the main area, but lovely beach.We were moved there from a sister resort by hotel management (with our permission), at the hotel's recommendation , as it was Spring Break. No games room, the restaurant and bar were closed, no restaurants nearby unless you had a vehicle; we flew in. Rooms ok but small, overpriced compared to others - we had friends at the Daytone Conference Centre, they had a great room, great location. We were supposed to be at the Acapulco's sister hotel (Plaza) which had a great location, but we gathered it was really crazy at March Break. Overall an Ok time, but would not stay there again, we would try elsewhere.Walked to "The Shores" (where we had almost booked because of an awesome sale on Expedia), it was STUNNING! We ate there, the food was exceptional. If you catch a deal, go there, it wasjust amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but not great.”
Reviews.Author: I75burner
Reviews.Content: To start out, they must have really been hit hard by the spring break crowd. The rooms were in need of new carpet( or at least cleaning), The patio area had tables and chairs stacked but unable to sit at, the pool area needs to be re-painted. The beach retaining wall needs painting (bad!) The continental breakfast was 'so-so'. But, don't be one minute late, there were 10 people in line and the guy starts taking the food out. This could be a really great hotel, if kept up a little bit better. The lobby looks fancy, just dirty. The plusses: the beds were comfortable and the TV and wireless internet worked good. The view from the oceanfront rooms is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of little things adding up to us not staying there again”
Reviews.Author: suprm2001
Reviews.Content: The problems started at check in. We got checked in, got to our room, and it was the wrong kind. I had booked (and paid for) an oceanfront efficiency. What we got was a regular room, not oceanfront. Went down to the front desk with my printed confirmation in hand. Waited for quite a while, and was finally told that they didn't know what was going on, but they couldn't get me into an oceanfront room, and to try again in the morning to see if there were any no shows. When I asked about adjusting the rate, he told me I would have to talk to the manager in the morning. (I did notice while we were waiting that we were not the only ones waiting because we were not in the correct kind of room.) When we got to the room, the roll away was not in the room as promised, so we had to call down about that. The guy did bring the bed up promptly, and while he was there, I showed him that the lock on the door was broken. The service guy also showed up promptly to fix it, and was polite. After a barely restful night of sleep, because the air conditioner sounded like a 747 every time it kicked on,(and at 7 a.m. somebody was filling their cooler from the ice machine right outside of our room) the next morning we went down to the desk, and the manager was there, and had fixed the room problem. She gave us the key to our new room, but wouldn't look me in the eye, and barely talked to me at all. The free internet didn't work for me at all the entire week we were there, the signal was just too weak. The pool was nice, and the access to the beach was convenient. The $5 a day parking, however, was not. And the parking lot spaces are a bit cramped, I had some trouble getting my van parked well when the lot was full. The rooms were clean, and the name brand toiletries provided were appreciated. However, I really didn't like the shower, and finding a temperature that wasn't scalding hot or ice cold was tricky. The final blow for me on not staying there again, was that while we were waiting for the elevators to check out, the cleaning staff were cleaning rooms, and they used profanity very much in ear shot of me and my young children. Totally not acceptable. p.s.-our rate for that first night was never adjusted either.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: silvo021
Reviews.Content: we had a lovely holiday at this hotel 2 years ago in late september so it was pretty quite when we stayed. The breakfast was a bit basic just continental style, our room was nice with a useful kitchen area, and we had a half sea view from the balcony. The staff were very helpful especially the old fella at breakfast always made sure we were okay. We did find it was a bit too quite, the area i mean was a bit isolated. We loved the pool as we seemed to have it to ourselfs most days and we loved the beach, so empty not like the packed beaches back in the uk.

Reviews.Title: “VERY ACCOMMODATING”
Reviews.Author: newportdog
Reviews.Content: We were moved from the Mayan Inn because of the noise at night from the bands that play at Ocean Deck and I have to say that the front desk manager at the Acapulco was very accommodating to us and extremely nice. Our stay was relaxing and the rooms were very clean and roomy. All the staff was very friendly and we have nothing bad at all to say about this hotel. We had a great room overlooking the pool and ocean, and the breakfast was good (for a complimentary breakfast). We have nothing but good things to say about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel.. would stay there again.”
Reviews.Author: ukjackie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 10 nights in february over Speedweeks ..We booked a package holiday so got it at a reasonable rate... the night prior to the 500 they charge $400.. i would not pay that. We tried to check in early due to going to the Bud Shootout that night.. the assistant manager wanted $50 for the privelage so we declined... we later found out the hotel does not charge for early check in. When we did check in we were allocated a room overlooking the sea, everything was clean and tidy . Housekeeping was good, towels etc changed everyday. Free breakfast is ok cereal,pastries, bagels, toast etc. Hotel advertises free wifi we and several others couldnt get it too work.. everyday i asked at reception and the assistant manager said it will be working later !! For the 1st 4 days of our stay the room safe was locked.. i repeatedly asked for it too be opened and eventually after getting angry i got it sorted. I also found out on the last day from the receptionist we should have been given a number to call to sort out the wifi ! Because of the rubbish weather we didnt get to use the pool etc but it looked nice and clean. Overall we enjoyed our stay there and would go back... but the attitude of the assistant manager leaves an awful lot to be desired.. everything is too much trouble for her and it wasnt just us complaining about her.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: funinthesun70
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over the past weekend. This was the 1st time ever to Daytona Beach and Florida for that matter. The hotel overall was great. The few times I spoke with front desk, they were nice and helpful with what I was needing. The rooms aren't really fancy, but what I expected. A few stains on the carpet, but everything else was clean. Our room was a oceanview on the south side of the building. The view of the ocean was amazing and pretty much as good as a oceanfront room. The beach access is within a few feet of the hotel. Only one hot tub was working, but it felt great. The pool was open, but cold like the ocean due to cold temps from the previous week. The free breakfast was a nice way to save some $$ on meals. Just mainly muffins, bagels, toast, cereal, and fruit. The guy that overseas the breakfast was the nicest guy we met on the whole trip. Very friendly and made sure you knew where everything was. The elevators are slow, but we were there at a non-busy time, so not as big of a deal. You can get the in-safe charge removed at check out as well if you dont use it. This hotel was well worth the price spent per night. It is south of all the main attractions, so keep that in mind.

Reviews.Title: “Suprisingly Great!”
Reviews.Author: sharkluver22
Reviews.Content: Staff was amazing. They were pleasant every time they saw us, saying good morning/afternoon/evening. The front desk was friendly and gave great recommendations. Rooms were kept clean, nice decor, lovely bathrooms. The sliding door to the balcony was hard to open, but that's to be expected from all the salty air from the beach. Great view from our room. Continental Breakfast left room to be desired. Pool area was great, plenty of lounge chairs. Elevator was a bit slow, but I was on vacation, so in no hurry.

Reviews.Title: “Ok Hotel, needs updating, Misc charges are bothersome”
Reviews.Author: Frylaw
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms, 4 guys, down there for a footbal game for a long weekend. Place was OK, rooms were a little worn. Staff was great. The pictures were misleading. Misc charges for parking, use of the computer, overcharging for laundry, were disappointing. Not sure if I would go back. I would recommend only if those understood the limitations. Bar/restaurant was not open.

Reviews.Title: “Nice family place”
Reviews.Author: beltonkk
Reviews.Content: I think is a good value for the money, family and friendly atmosphere, very nice people in the front desk, the room about the same than others same category hotel, clean and the fridge and microwave make things easier if you are traveling with small kids, nice touch: Body body and Works in the bathroom. You are going to be close to Publix, Win Dixie and CVS for 'supplies". The breakfast is not a big deal, just basics, but if you dont want spend extra money could be an economically helpfull option, anyway you always can try another place . Contra: Elevators are old, slow, small, they have 2, not enough for summer season.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for a beach front hotel”
Reviews.Author: Travelforfun2
Reviews.Content: We were there for 2 nights in mid September. Upon check-in, we were struck by how busy the hotel seemed to be, with people wandering around everywhere. We just barely found a place to park. The woman at the front desk was very friendly and quickly checked us in and sent us on our way. Unfortunately that was easier said than done! Not only are the elevators slow, but there was a big family reunion taking place at the hotel, and some kids were running around pressing all the floor buttons on the elevator making them even slower!! Normally we would take the stairs (we were only on the 4th floor), but we were carrying lots of luggage and groceries so we had no choice but to wait. Needless to say, we later ALWAYS used the stairs, so the problem was solved. Actually, I must mention that the staff knew about the mischief these children were getting into, and sent security to check on it. I don't know how it all got resolved, but I was happy to see that they were on it. The beds were WONDERFULLY comfortable! I was pleasantly surprised. We booked a standard room, but were pleasantly surprised to see that we were still able to sit out on our balcony and enjoy the oceanview. Our room didn't directly face the ocean, but we had a side facing room that was as close as you can get to these rooms. What a bonus! We also enjoyed having a fridge and free internet in our room. The continental breakfast was acceptable, though standard. The first morning was PACKED, so we had to wait in line for everything. However, the family reunion people checked out that morning, so the next day and a half were completely crowd-free. We almost had the pool to ourselves, lots of parking to choose from, and no lines for the breakfast! In short, we were pleased with our stay. For the price, we really can't complain. There were only minor issues (the crowds on the first night, slow elevator, the hottub never did work, some public areas are starting to show age and need for repair). The location was pretty good, in that the you were only a short drive away to the pier and other touristy locations. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again. I wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Very Clean!”
Reviews.Author: Peacetoyou
Reviews.Content: After following the reviews on Trip Advisor, I found that the Acapulco hotel and resort was the best hotel for the money. The rooms were extremely clean, which is my top priority, everything else wasn't as important to me. The staff was very nice and the beach was so close. You can choose not to use the safe in the room and they will remove it and not charge you the $1.50/day, but it was nice to have. Overall we enjoyed it there and will utilize them again. Keep in mind, parking is a little tight. We were there for labor day weekend but thank goodness we had a small car. The $5 daily parking fee is a bit bizarre but you really don't have a choice. Elevator was so slow we took the stairs the nearly the entire time, but that was okay because we were on the second floor. If you are going to travel during the busy season or holiday, ask for a lower level room so you can easily walk to your room and either park early in the day or drive a smaller vehicle. Also, don't plan to stay around the pool much if you don't like crowds. The pool is a bit small and was always at capacity, but the ocean is just a few feet away!

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: jazzyjane17
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this hotel. The staff was very friendly. The room was clean with a great view of the beach and ocean even though we were on the side. The pool was lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome”
Reviews.Author: kkpaige
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely phoneomenal. The rooms were very clean. The staff was awesome. The lobby was nicely decorated and the property was kept clean. We had an oceanview room with double beds and we loved it. I came back from vacation raving about this place. I will recommend this hotel anytime.

Reviews.Title: “alright..”
Reviews.Author: Cat5Cat5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok. The room was really small and the elevators were horrilbe. we had to walk up the stairs to go our room. they were so slow. The breakfast was nice. Great beach, nice pool, but the hot tubs didn't work and the pool chairs were stained with mildew. And then when we checked out we were charged $5 a day for parking and an extra $1.50 a day for the safe in our closet. CRAZY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lauraralph03
Reviews.Content: My husband & I were here July 6-11. The Staff could not have been any nicer! We happened to bump into the Housekeeping Mgr as we exited the elevator; and requested 4 extra pillows; which she brought to our room immediately. The sliding glass door to our balcony was hard to open.....I called Robert at the desk & Jeffrey was knocking on our door in 5 minutes! Talk about service! Our room & bathroom were extra clean (I have a habit of wiping switches, door handles, telephone &, remote control with a Clorox wipe and checking between the mattress/boxspring for bedbugs; as soon as we enter ANY hotel room and the wipe was barely dirty and no bedbugs were found). You can't expect the carpeting to be shampooed weekly, but it was vacuumed dailey (we don't go barefoot in hotel rooms). Our King size bed was very comfortable, as were the pillows. Ample beach/ bath towels and accessories were left dailey. The construction crew on the street did not start til 8am and we could not hear any outside noise from inside our room (which was closest to the street). We did not use the room safe; but noticed a sign on top the safe, under the beach towels; stating that you could request the safe charge to be taken off your bill at check-out. Upon check-out I did make this request & the charge was deleted. Also, upon check-in, I informed the manager... Melisa of my handicap placard & we were not charged for parking. As for previous review complaints regarding the slow elevators (you are on vacation & should not be in a hurry or looking at clocks... elevators are the only free rides in the world) and the pool lounges not being clean (put a beach towel down first)! We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and will return next month!!!

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about hotel, it was CHEAP”
Reviews.Author: arie1428
Reviews.Content: we stayed monday through thursday. the rooms were nice, carpets had stains on them (something sticky) 1st night cockroach on wall , bathroom was clean, shower pressure was good, lots of hot water, tub didn't drain fast had to stand in about inch of water while showering and shower was loud. beds are small uncomfortable, my mother and sister preferred the floor then the bed. bath and body works shower gel, lotion and soap was nice. view was beautiful (oceanfront). pool was ok. it really needs a good scrubbing. lounge chairs outside are old and need to be bleached or something they had black mold on them, but with a drink from the tiki bar its not so bad. spa is now just a "hot tub" jets don't work anymore. they did come out every morning and sweep pool area and vacuum pool. continental breakfast was ok. staff was helpful, they brought extra towels right away, cleaning ladies vacuumed replaced lotions/ soaps everyday. I would stay again but pool area was a big disappointment, and they need to get bigger beds

Reviews.Title: “Average”
Reviews.Author: roadtripper87
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just stayed here and average is a pretty good way of describing our experience. Here are the pros and cons so you can decide for yourself: PROS: -All rooms have at least a small ocean view -Very clean -The continental breakfast is nice -Beachfront!!!!!! -Nice pool -the Tiki Bar by the pool -Fridge and microwave in every room -The staff was somewhat friendly (but mildly abrasive) CONS -Elevators are frightening. We were there five days and they kept putting out of order signs on one several different times. They bounce when it stops at your floor! -The stairwell stinks! I could barely stand it. -The bar & grill was NEVER OPEN while we were there. Total waste. -The tiki bar, while nice, was only open weather-permitting and the bartender would take off pretty regularly and just pop up at some point. -The room was very small. -The really do nickel-and-dime charge you for the in-room safe & parking. It's a 100% profit for them, and it really shows they are not dedicated toward serving the customer. -The hot tubs were scary. The other reviews tell the truth-the paint is chipped and floating around, the jets don't work, and they don't get cleaned. Only one was actually semi-warm and lit up at night while we were there. -The parking lights are non-existent. There is some glow from the hotel, if you're lucky enough to get a spot that close. -The internet didn't work at all during our visit. So there you go. I wouldn't ever stay here again or recommend it to a friend, because there are better hotels in the area for the price tag. And beware!! Right now there is a TON of construction going on at all hours of the night, so you can't really hear the calming ocean!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value with a Fantastic Beach”
Reviews.Author: alfugate
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have been to Daytona Beach many times. And isn't that what you go for anyway? The beach? We don't have to have a palace to stay in...because we use the room for showering, changing clothes, and sleeping only. Now this place wasn't a palace..but it wasn't a dump either. It was a cute little hotel. The rooms looked a little dated. It was just an older, seaside hotel. However, they were very clean and the hotel service was very good. They always had fresh towels and soaps, shampoos, etc. for us. Everyone was very friendly. Our room had a view of the ocean. It also had a microwave and fridge. It was everything that we needed. We cooked most of our meals in the room in the microwave. The maids even left us some dish towels...so nice of them! There was a room safe in the closet...which was nice. There were also pool towels in the room! I was very impressed with that! The pool was amazing...so big and very clean. The water was amazing. The best part is that there is a beach access right by the pool. The beach is wonderful and there is a place to rent beach chairs and golf carts and ATVs right there! We rented a golf cart ..... if you go before 11 AM then you get 1/2 hour free! It was only $40 an hour for the golf cart...very good deal! We got the 1/2 hour free also....even better! We had a wonderful vacation. The only negative things I can say about the hotel is that it is sometimes hard to find a parking spot. But that is everywhere! Also, the elevator is very slow! And the air conditioner is set on a motion sensor. If you are sitting still in your room for a long period of time, the air conditioner will shut off...you have to wave your arm to get it to come back on. I had never seen anything like that before...lol. Overall, it was a GREAT value! We loved it and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “No no no.... take advice on Tripadvisor reviews and don't bother”
Reviews.Author: DavidGS96
Reviews.Content: Don't usually write reviews, but this hotel is a dud. Should have taken the advice read on Tripadvisor before we booked. The hotel states that they have had a $3m renovation but we couldn't see where any of the money was spent. Room carpet was filthy, generally a grotty looking hotel. Except for breakfast, we did not see the restaurant open for lunch or dinner, and the pool bar opening was sporadic, and very limited. The hotel charges for parking and use of the safe, which we know about, but many other hotels do not. When we informed the management what we are cancelling the rest of out stay they didn't seem bothered and we suspect that they were used to the critisism. Saying that, they made it easy for us to leave after the 2nd day. ***Please note that we contacted Hotels.Com by phone on the day we left, who very helpful in mediating and resolving the refund with this hotel, and would have no hesitation in using Hotels.Com in the future.*** We moved to the Plaza Hotel & Resort. Although operated by the same company who run the Acapulco, the Plaze was superb; clean, great staff, nice pool, fantastic room with a full beach view, for only a little more money. Don't make the same mistake as we did.... read these poor reviews of the Acapulco and stay away.... at least until they actually do spend some real money and clean the place up.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: kglw
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Acapulco Hotel! Front desk staff was super nice and went out of their way to be accomodating...especially Jennifer (front desk supervisor)! We arrived 2 hours prior to check-in and were told we could check in in an hour...they let us change in the restroom and offered us pool towels while we waited! The room was beautiful. I am very picky about cleanliness and I was impressed with the condition of the room/carpets/bedspreads, etc. Everything in our room looked like it had recently been remodeled (we were in 611). They even provided Bath and Body Works soaps, lotions, shower gel and shampoos! Our balcony had a view of the city, inlet waterway and the ocean...traffic could be heard at times, but that's what happens when you are near a busy road! Air conditioner was a little noisy...constantly turning off and on...heard the front desk supervisor explain to a lady ahead of me as I was checking out that they can be adjusted if you ask the front desk...do wish I had known that before my check-out, but mentioned that to her and she took off my parking fee and safe fee and I didn't even know it until I looked at my bill walking out the door! Speaking of the parking fees and safe fee, it is clearly stated on your form at check-in that you are resposible for those charges. It also states it on the website! I do think that these are unnecessary charges, but for the cost of the hotel, even adding those on, it is still very affordable! I do agree that the pool side chairs need some attention...I wouldn't say there was mold on them, though. They were just worn. Only one hot tub was working (and the paint was peeling from the bottom) when we were there, but when it's 95 degrees, you don't want to spend much time in them, anyway! The continental breakfast was very nice...the man who takes care of things every morning does a great job...I would consider him efficient, not the bother that the other reviewer said! As far as taking things to your room from the breakfast, I'm sure they had people abuse it and take some food for their lunch, too, so you know how it is...there is always someone out there who ruins it for everybody! I just can't say enough about the front desk staff...Jennifer was there every day we were there and couldn't have been nicer. Another young lady at the front desk helped register us online for our flight home the day before we left the hotel, which was a big help for us in getting seats on the plane the next day! The next time we come to Daytona Beach, I can guarantee you we will be staying at this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great price, great value”
Reviews.Author: terlyn09
Reviews.Content: We visited Acapulco the week of June 8, 2009 and were very pleased with our accommodations. We were a last minute arrival. Our other accommodation plans fell through so we were in a pinch to find a great place, but couldn't afford to break the bank. The hotel manager was able to find us a great room at a great price, and even let us look at the room before we committed tp stay. The rooms were nice, neat and very clean. Everything worked well, TV, iron, blow dryer. Our particular room's bathroom was a little small, but it was clean and the bath products they provided were Bath & Body Works. The continental breakfast was fine, mostly dry types of foods like toast, bagels, muffins, cereal. Pool and pool area was great, clean, it was a very nice pool. Oh and the Tiki stand bartender was excellent - not just the drinks he made, but he was super nice and outgoing! We would definitely stay there again if we are ever back in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Would not return for another visit, would not recommend to a friend”
Reviews.Author: lwurth
Reviews.Content: Lobby was very nice. Pool was very nice and clean. Nice Staff. OK.. that 's the positive. We chose this place for Tiki Bar and Bohemian Grill - Tiki Bar never opened outside while we were there, no food being served at Grill the entire time we were there. Blankets were scratchy, sheets had holes. Elevators slow (Thanks to trip advisor i was aware of this and asked for second floor) we took stairs the entire stay!. No gift shop, no local newspaper, I was scolded by staff for taking bagel and coffee to my room (free continental breakfast) WHAT? and WHY? Hubby and I slept ok, daughter difficulty with mattress confort. Ugly wooden ramp in center of pool area, why?, dirty plexiglass blocking the entire oceanview when sitting poolside, We paid extra for ocean front and there was no sliding glass door to balcony-a heavy door that is incapable of staying open. Dish towel in kitchen was so stained (probably clean) i refused to use it, maybe nice for my garage at home! Jacuzzi's were not functioning properly-one no jets working, the other was not at a hot temp - Room and hall smelled like old smoke , no payper view, no fitness room, no gift shop, Carpet in Room 203 was terribly stained. So.. why is this called Boutique Chic? Pay for parking each day.!?. is ridiculous.... who comes to a hotel without a car? DUH!

Reviews.Title: “Find Another Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Aloha71
Reviews.Content: The room we reserved was taken so they gave us a smaller one. It smelled bad because the carpet was wet, they said it had rained a lot. We moved to another room where the sliding door was broken. Over all it was run down and not maintained. Not worth the money at all.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel and a great price”
Reviews.Author: OhioBeachtraveler
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean and comfortable. The price was one of the best on the beach. The rooms are recently renovated and the beds were very comfortable. The staff was friendly and willing to help in any way. The swimming pool was large and there were 2 nice hot tubs if you wanted to relax. The tiki hut by the pool offered a bonus for those who would like to enjoy a drink poolside. The location of the hotel is quiet, just up from the start of the condo area. We will definately choose this hotel next time we come into the area.

Reviews.Title: “easy location, right on beach, renovated, clean comfy rooms”
Reviews.Author: ALC_Chicago
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time staying here. The room was very comfortable and nicely appointed - the whole hotel had been recently renovated. This is a family-oriented hotel (the pool area fills up early) but the place was very quiet. All rooms have a view to the water. There is easy parking in the hotel lot and prices are reasonable. Note that you need to drive to any restaurants. I would definitely stay here again.
