Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel!!!!!! One of the best places to stay in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: bebe3977
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! I loved the balcony with the ocean view. The staff was VERY helpful and friendly. The tiki bar service was fantastic. I look forward to returning. It's a great deal!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: mbw885
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival we were welcomed with great hosipitality, I have to say Ms. Davis the manager at the front desk was great. She got us in a room quick and for a good rate. They do charge for parking ($5 a day) but she waived the charge at the end of our stay. All of the staff are very welcoming and eager to help with any and eveything you need for your stay. We had a great view, they always kept the pool deck clean and safe which was a very big thing for us since we have a 2 year old. Really the only thing bad about the hotel would have to be the slow and outdated elevators. Hope everyone else enjoys there stay as much as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ksrinlv
Reviews.Content: Deciding at the last minute to stay at a hotel after the Daytona 500, we were more than pleased with our choice of the Acapulco Hotel. It was easy to find, front desk was very welcoming on our arrival. The room was pleasant, clean, beds super comfy, and the little balcony with a bit of an ocean view was fun. The room even had a nice sized kitchenette with fridge, sink and cooktop, and cupboards well stocked with dishes. The free continental breakfast was great, very pleased with the selection and quality, and a great room to eat it facing the ocean. Overall, incredibly happy with our choice, would stay there again and recommend to others!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful View”
Reviews.Author: pooltable123
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a romantic getaway, the oceanfront room had a balcony with chairs and a table, we spent time out there looking at the ocean and hearing the waves crashing on the sand. If you love the ocean right outside your window, this is the place to stay. The beds were comfortable, the room was a good size, the elevators were slow, so we used the stairs a lot, didn't really have much interaction with staff. I did make reservations over the phone and it was actually less expensive than on line through the known discount internet services. There are charges for parking each day ($5.00) and room safe, but they will take the charge off for the room safe if you don't use it, but you have to ask. The onsite bar and restaurant were supposed to be open, but were not when we were there. Overall, it was a nice on the beach hotel for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: 4givN
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. The rooms are beautiful and spotlessly clean. The beds are quite comfortable with lots of pillows. The staff were VERY friendly and looked like they enjoyed their jobs. We had an direct ocean front room that had a breathtaking view of the ocean, with no obstructions like the rooms on the side have. These rooms also have a much larger PRIVATE balcony. We highly recommend spending just a bit more for the view! With the door propped open the beautiful ocean breezes freshen the room, and with the door closed you can't hear the roar of the ocean. Breakfast was included for us, and as others have commented on, has something for everyone...and plenty of it. Our breakfast attendant was great. Our daughter wasn't feeling well Christmas morning. We went down to get a tray to bring back to her, and mentioned this to him,. He disappeared and returned with a plate of Christmas goodies for her that weren't available in the breakfast area! Very thoughtful! YES the elevators are slow and quite small. It wasn't bad when we first arrived, but the hotel started to fill up after Christmas, and then we did wait. TIP: the elevator at the road side of the hotel is faster! Most people wait for the one near the ocean side because it's closest to the breakfast area and the pool/ocean...making it even slower!! The pool area is only in the sun for the morning hours and is quite chilly! The condo that was built next door blocks the sun for the afternoon ( see photo ), so that's a good time to sit on the beach. There are two hot tubs, only one of which was out of order, the other WAS working which the other reviewer neglected to mention. They also drained and cleaned the hot tub and scrubbed the area around it at night. There is a kiddie pool as well, but both pools get quite sandy because people clean their feet in them. There is a foot wash at ground level at the gate to the beach, and also a shower on the other side! Would be good if they had a sign for the foot wash, cause obviously most people don't know it's there! YES the parking charge is annoying ($5.33 inc tax per day), but the safe charge can be reversed if you don't use it. The only other thing that bothered us was our room had a connecting door to a room with a King size bed. The couple that stayed there reqested a playpen for their baby and it was set up directly in front of the connecting door!! So we heard them, and the baby crying for most of the nights that they were there...but other than that the rooms were pretty soundproof. The kitchen had all the dishes that we needed, but we were short on silverware. We mentioned this to the front desk, and within the hour we had what we requested delivered to our room! We booked this hotel months before, at a buy one night, get one free special, so we paid about $600 Canadian dollars for 8 nights in an oceanfront suite. ..not bad!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT worth the money!!”
Reviews.Author: graemii
Reviews.Content: What a pathetic place! They did not give us the room we had reserved and then charged for parking even though their website, at the time, did not state that there would be parking fees. Apparently the website was outdated but they still wouldn't waive the fee. Also the hot tub was out of order when we were there. Everything was a total rip off! We had to stay one night because we couldn't get our money back and then they charged a cancellation fee of $50.00. I gladly paid that instead of giving them $800.00 for a week. Totally ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “KEEP AWAY... unless you want to be hit with extra charges”
Reviews.Author: oceanquest333
Reviews.Content: As a frequent travel both within the USA and abroad, I believe I am fair when it comes to reviews. As long as the hotel is clean and comfortable, which this hotel was.... I am normally satisfied and seldom complain. What did bother me with this particular hotel was them trying to "fleece" extra charges at check out... For instance a room safe that was not used, and parking in an empty parking lot for five bucks a day. I did get my American Express to cancel the charge, but like most people, it was not about the money..... it was the principal of the matter. With this in mind, I would surely not recommend this or any other hotel that attempts to cheat its guests for "petty charges". I know Daytona Beach well, since I owned my Cruise Boat business there for many years, and would recommend if you are visiting that fine city.... DONT STAY AT A PLACE THAT CHEATS IT GUESTS... There are too many other good and honest hotels in Daytona Beach.. Enjoy your visit....

Reviews.Title: “Alright BUT better choices in the area!”
Reviews.Author: Kerjner
Reviews.Content: Hello Trippies, As always i will try and make my review of the hotel thorough to help you out the best i can on your vacation. I was meeting some business friends in Daytona Beach and i chose to stay at this hotel. I received a rate of $89 + parking fees on Priceline so i thought it was a good deal. As you read in previous reviews the staff really is the lifeline of this hotel. The staff at the Acapulco are very kind and accomodating. ROOM The rooms at the Acapulco are quite large for the price. I was lucky to get a room upgrade to a top floor ocean front. The view was wonderful and the room was good all around. Ask for room 801. You can't go wrong. ;<) My room had a stove, eating utensiles, microwave, mini fridge with freezer and a sink to clean dishes. Amenity wise the rooms are good. No complaints really. STAFF As mentioned i did get a room upgrade to ocean front for only a few dollars more. The staff was quite accomodating about having me stay an extra day even though they were fully booked. They did their best and succeeded in making room for the extra night. HOTEL You may hear of parking issues on previous reviews. I was at the Acapulco during the Turkey Run at Daytona. The hotel was at capacity and there was room for all cars no problem. I was returning between 1 and 2 in the morning and there was room for me to park no problem. The lobby is good and up to date. They offer a free morning breakfast which i don't know if i can really recommend. I prefer not to go in to cardiac arrest. The breakfast consisted of a fruit salad which was mediocre. The rest was items like mini donuts of various types and greasy muffins. I would certainly go out of the hotel if you are looking for a healthier breakfast alternative. The pool area is okay. It consists of two hot tubs and a pool. There is also 2 shuffle board courts for kids. LOCATION Acapulco is right on the beach. If you like to go for a walk on the beach in the morning it is perfect. IT IS FAR TRENDY RESTAURANTS AND THE ACTION IN DAYTONA BEACH. You will have to drive about 6 miles which takes about 15-20 minutes to get to the trendy area with all the good restaurants. DISLIKES The elevators at the Acapulco are the slowest in the nation. The night i go there i was quite patient and understanding. After a couple of days, however, you get tired of waiting 10 minutes for the elevators. No word of a lie... you will have to wait 10 minutes for the elevator.. no exaggeration here. There are 2 elevators and i was told by some guests that they actually got stuck in one of the elevators AND one guest even claimed he had to pry the door open to get out. My other dislike about the hotel is that it can get loud. I was getting back as mentioned earlier at 1-2 in the morning and there were people drinkng and partying in the hallways. MY OVERALL IMPRESSION The price was okay but really there's nothing incredible about the hotel that would make me go back. The good staff just isn't enough to make this hotel a winner or a memorable experience when in Daytona Beach. My friends stayed at Daytona Beach Resort and Conference Center. I would highly recommend this hotel because of the great location and the fact that it is much nicer. I hope this helps you in your travels to Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Dublin16Family
Reviews.Content: November 8, 2008 Reviewer: Family from Dublin, Ireland Just returned from a short stay at the Acapulco. It was a perfect location for the family of 5 - it's right on the beach. The kids had great fun in the pool and hot-tubs. This area was well tended and made it very appealing. The view from the balcony over the pool area to the immediately adjacent Atlantic Ocean was magnificent and definitely a major selling point for the hotel. Unfortunately other less attractive developments detract from the quaint appeal of the Acapulco. If it's afternoon and evening balcony sunshine you're seeking you may wish to choose a south facing room which will have some ocean views but also a view of an uninspiring newly-built apartment block - not the Acapulco's fault! The room was well appointed with a fridge, microwave and hob. However there are plenty of places to eat locally. Breakfast was lovely with fruit, yoghurts, cereals and muffins available. The hotel was clean and well maintained although the decor was a little dated. The staff were friendly and helpful. Would I stay here again - unreservedly yes!!

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive, but all the right stuff!”
Reviews.Author: foalpatrol
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in Daytona, staff are over the top courteous, rooms were clean ( bathrooms are a bit small) Views from the balconies are spectacular. We stayed for 6 nights in October and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. Breakfast buffet could use some more variety ( waffles perhaps?) but hey! it's free!! The pool was sparkling clean and perfect as far as chemicals (not too much chlorine as you sometimes see). The kitchenettes in the rooms allow you to buy groceries and cook in the rooms (which can save $ so you can spend it on ATVs on the beach and such!) Was it worth the travel from KY? You bet!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: bonzsi
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at the last minute for "Biktoberfest" and found it to be clean and comfortable. We stayed on the north side with an ocean view in a standard 2 dbl bed room- which was just fine (Looked just like the pic). The only complaint was that the dbl beds are really small so my husband slept in one bed and I in the other because it was too close (requested a king but none available). The rooms were kept clean and fresh towels everyday Free continental bkfst was nice. As far as the $5.00 a day additonal parking fee - I was told it was included in the total I had charged to my card but when we arrived they tried to charge again and since we trailered our bike down we had to park this offsite with an additional $15.00 a day fee (of which we were never informed of in advance - especially since I asked upfront) I don't understand the parking fee - I am paying to park in the hotel lot - why not include this in the rate of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, Great staff...”
Reviews.Author: Patrick G
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my family and had a second room for some friends. I knew the hotel was one of the better hotels in daytona beach so i kinda knew what to expect for a room and amenities but was really pleasantly surprised by how welcoming and accommodating all of the staff were that i came in contact with. The guy that checked me in smiled and was accommodating. A few hours into our stay, the AC in our room started to make a knocking sound, i called it in and within a few minutes, one of the staff was up and fixed it, again, with a really nice personality and open to conversation. When he left, he said if you need anything else i'll be here until midnight. The next morning we went down to get some breakfast as the hotel was offering a free continental breakfast and the guy that was attending to it was working really hard at everyone's requests. he went so far to warm up my son's milk in the microwave and get a few other specialty items that we requested. We had an oceanfront efficiency room and a connecting oceanview room with 2 beds. Both were very nice with private balconies. There was a full moon when we stayed and it was beautiful overlooking the pool area and ocean from our balcony.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MOLLYLancashire
Reviews.Content: we stayed here 4 nights had a great time excellent staff especially barbara at the tiki bar and indoor bar also will the manager very friendly to .rooms very clean with nice added touch of lovely soaps we had a room on side of hotel but still had great view of beach and ocean could also see halifax river from balcony .pool was lovely clean and right by the beach we had food by pool one day was lovely and very resonable priced .main hotel areas very presentable.would deffinatly stay here again good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Cracking Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lucygoosy77
Reviews.Content: What a little gem if your on a budget. Lovely clean rooms with lots of FREE extras, Free poolside coffee for one, Nice touch. Restaurant is a little pricey but lots of supermarkets for milk cereal and crossaints. One for the BRITS. Enjoy at your leisure.

Reviews.Title: “We would recommend this great hotel ........”
Reviews.Author: IreHolidaymakers
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Acapulco Hotel in July 2008.It was our first time in Daytona and we were delighted with the Hotel. Pros - The reception area, lifts, hall ways were very clean. All staff were extremely helpfull and friendly. Room cleaning was very good - daily cleaning and daily supply of clean towels for both the room and beach / pool area. View from all rooms is excellant as all rooms can view the beach The hotel is on the beach and has easy access to the beach Hotel was nice and quiet with no excess noise or trouble There were ice and vending machines on alternate floors Cons - Pool area was clean but could be cleaner - e.g. pool deck was not washed down daily, rubbish not picked up daily The restaurant opened and closed at various hours depending on how many people were aroun. Therefore it was easy to get caught out without food as it could close at 4 in the afternoon ! The hotel automatically charges all rooms a daily fee of $5 + taxes for parking and $1.50 plus taxes for the safety depsoit box. On check out then you have to explain how many actual days you used it for Both hot tubs were not working Summary - we would recommend the hotel and stay there again. But Hire a car as the Daytona areais so big it is hard to get around and the buses only run 2 per hour !

Reviews.Title: “The Best Daytona Stay I've Experienced”
Reviews.Author: bethied74
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Daytona Beach and this is, by far, the best hotel I've experienced. We had a nightmare last year when we stayed at the La Playa (DON'T go there). I can't say enough about the housekeeping staff. They are so personable! If we would happen to come back to the room while they were working, they would just fuss over my two year old twins and try to make them laugh. The pool area was nice and the access to the beach was perfect. It's on the south end of Daytona Beach and away from all the Boardwalk hubbub. As soon as I know the dates for our next vacation, I'm definitely booking the Acapulco!

HotelInfo.Name: Acapulco Hotel & Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 2505 South Atlantic Ave., Daytona Beach, FL 32118
